Translations of "họ̀ndúràs" into English in sentences, translation memory

Òǹkọ̀wé Vatican náà, Luigi Accattoli, sọ pé: “Ìjẹ́wọ́ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn kókó tí ń dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀ jù lọ nínú Ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì Kátólíìkì.
“The confession of sin is one of the most controversial subjects within the Catholic Church,” says Vatican commentator Luigi Accattoli.
jw2019
Nítorí gbogbo àwọn tí ń ṣe nǹkan wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà.”
For whoever does these things is detestable to Jehovah.”
jw2019
Nítorí gbogbo àwọn tí ń ṣe nǹkan wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ní tìtorí ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí wọ̀nyí sì ni Jèhófà Ọlọ́run rẹ yóò fi lé wọn lọ kúrò níwájú rẹ.”
For everybody doing these things is something detestable to Jehovah, and on account of these detestable things Jehovah your God is driving them away from before you.”
jw2019
Họ́wù, láti ọjọ́ tí àwọn baba ńlá wa ti sùn nínú ikú, ohun gbogbo ń bá a lọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti rí láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀pẹ̀pẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀dá.”—2 Pétérù 3:4.
Why, from the day our forefathers fell asleep in death, all things are continuing exactly as from creation’s beginning.” —2 Peter 3:4.
jw2019
5 Bóyá o ń ronú níbi tí a dé yìí pé: ‘Họ́wù, mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ ìdílé mi, ṣùgbọ́n kò rí bí irú èyí tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ júwe tán yìí.
5 Perhaps at this point you are thinking: ‘Well, I love my family, but it is not like the one just described.
jw2019
Wọn kò sunkún, wọn ò gé irun wọn, tàbí kí wọ́n wọ aṣọ àpò ìdọ̀họ láti fi hàn pé àwọn ronú pìwà dà.
They do not weep, cut their hair, or wear sackcloth as a sign of repentance.
jw2019
Nígbà tí Sólómọ́nì ń sọ ìdí tí ó fi fúnni ní àwọn àmọ̀ràn rẹ̀, ó ní: “Nítorí oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán.
Summing up the reason for his counsel, Solomon says: “For the devious person is a detestable thing to Jehovah, but His intimacy is with the upright ones.
jw2019
(Efesu 4: 31, 32; Jakọbu 3: 17, 18) Họ́wù, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀dọ́ ti borí àyíká ilé búburú pàápàá, bí wọ́n ti wá láti inú ìdílé tí ìmukúmu, ìwà ipá, tàbí agbára ìdarí mìíràn tí ń pani lára, ń yọ lẹ́nu, tí wọ́n sì ti dàgbà di ẹni tí ó ní láárí.
(Ephesians 4:31, 32; James 3:17, 18) Why, many youngsters have risen above even a bad home environment, coming from families marked by alcoholism, violence, or some other harmful influence, and have grown up to be fine adults.
jw2019
Bíbélì sọ pé: “Oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán.” —Òwe 3:32.
The Bible says: “Jehovah detests a devious person, but His close friendship is with the upright.” —Proverbs 3:32.
jw2019
Kò sí ẹni tí ó lè di ìdùnnú Kristian rẹ̀ mú bí ó bá ń fi irọ́, ìṣẹ̀fẹ̀ rírùn akóninírìíra, ati awọn ọ̀ràn àìṣòdodo, àìmọ́, tí kò bá ìwàrere mú, tí ó kún fún ìkórìíra, ati ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí kún èrò-inú ati ọkàn-àyà rẹ̀.
No one can maintain Christian joy if he fills his mind and heart with lies, foolish jesting, and matters that are unrighteous, immoral, without virtue, hateful, and detestable.
jw2019
(Róòmù 7:21; Éfésù 4:31) Kí làwọn nǹkan míì tó tún lè dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀?
(Romans 7:21; Ephesians 4:31) What other factors might cause tension?
jw2019
Họ́wù, àwọn ènìyàn orílẹ̀-èdè búburú yẹn lè ka ìkìlọ̀ mi sí ewu kan, wọ́n sì lè ṣẹ́gun Israeli!
Why, people of that wicked nation may consider my warning a threat and conquer Israel!
jw2019
Họ́wù, gbogbo ọgbọ́n tí aráyé ti kójọ jálẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀-ìtàn rẹ̀ jẹ́ ìwọ̀n bíńtín nígbà tí a bá fiwéra pẹ̀lú ìtọ́ni àtọ̀runwá tí a gbékarí ọgbọ́n aláìlópin ti Jehofa.
Why, all the worldly wisdom of the ages amounts to little when compared with divine instruction based on Jehovah’s infinite wisdom.
jw2019
Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti rí ní ọ̀pọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè míràn, họ́wùhọ́wù ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti bẹ́ sílẹ̀ ní Itali.
As in many other countries, a blood scandal has erupted in Italy.
jw2019
Họ́wù, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Jóòbù 12:7 ti wí, kódà “àwọn ẹran agbéléjẹ̀” àti “àwọn ẹ̀dá abìyẹ́lápá” pàápàá lè kọ́ni lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ bí wọn kò tilẹ̀ lè fọhùn!
Why, according to Job 12:7, even “domestic animals” and “winged creatures” can teach silently!
jw2019
Ní ti Mèsáyà, ẹni tí a “tẹ́ńbẹ́lú nínú ọkàn,” tí “orílẹ̀-èdè ń ṣe họ́ọ̀ sí,” ìlérí tí Jèhófà ṣe ni pé: “Àwọn ọba tìkára wọn yóò rí i, wọn yóò sì dìde dájúdájú, àti àwọn ọmọ aládé, wọn yóò sì tẹrí ba, nítorí Jèhófà, ẹni tí ó jẹ́ olùṣòtítọ́, Ẹni Mímọ́ Ísírẹ́lì, ẹni tí ó yàn ọ́.”—Aísáyà 49:7.
Regarding the Messiah, who is “despised in soul” and “detested by the nation,” Jehovah promises: “Kings themselves will see and certainly rise up, and princes, and they will bow down, by reason of Jehovah, who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel, who chooses you.” —Isaiah 49:7.
jw2019
Lẹ́yìn gbogbo ohun tí ó sì ti dé bá wa nítorí àwọn iṣẹ́ búburú wa àti ẹ̀bi ńláǹlà wa—nítorí pé ìwọ fúnra rẹ, ìwọ Ọlọ́run wa, ti ka ìṣìnà wa sí kékeré ju bí ó ti yẹ lọ, ìwọ sì ti fún wa ní àwọn tí ó sá àsálà, bí àwọn wọ̀nyí—ǹjẹ́ ó yẹ kí a tún máa rú àwọn àṣẹ rẹ, kí a sì máa bá àwọn ènìyàn tí ń ṣe àwọn ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí wọ̀nyí dána?
And after all that has come upon us for our bad deeds and our great guiltiness —for you yourself, O our God, have underestimated our error, and you have given us those who have escaped such as these— shall we go breaking your commandments again and forming marriage alliances with the peoples of these detestable things?
jw2019
Họ́wù, jẹ́ ká tibi ìrètí àjíǹde wò ó.
Just think, though, about the resurrection.
jw2019
Họ́wù, “láti kó wọn jọ pa pọ̀ sí ogun ọjọ́ ńlá Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè”!
Why, “to gather them together to the war of the great day of God the Almighty”!
jw2019
Họ́wù, iye tí ó lé ní 34,000 ní ó pésẹ̀ ní àwọn ìlú ńlá mẹ́jọ, tí àwọn 2,260 sì ṣèrìbọmi!
Why, over 34,000 attended in eight cities, and 2,260 were baptized!
jw2019
Họ́wù, ìdàgbàsókè tí ó wúnilórí, tí ó sì nítumọ̀ jùlọ ní ayé ń ṣẹlẹ̀ níhìn-ín gan-an nínú ètò-àjọ Jehofa!
Why, the most exciting, meaningful developments in the world happen right here within Jehovah’s organization!
jw2019
(Mátíù 7:1) Gbogbo àwa tá a wà nínú ìjọ ní láti ṣọ́ra ká má bàa dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀ nítorí àwọn ọ̀ràn tó jẹ mọ́ ẹ̀rí ọkàn kálukú.
(Matthew 7:1) All in the congregation want to avoid making an issue of personal matters of conscience.
jw2019
Sólómọ́nì sọ pé: “Ohun mẹ́fà ní ń bẹ tí Jèhófà kórìíra ní tòótọ́; bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, méje ni ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí fún ọkàn rẹ̀: ojú gíga fíofío, ahọ́n èké, àti ọwọ́ tí ń ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ aláìmọwọ́-mẹsẹ̀ sílẹ̀, ọkàn-àyà tí ń fẹ̀tàn hùmọ̀ àwọn ìpètepèrò tí ń ṣeni lọ́ṣẹ́, ẹsẹ̀ tí ń ṣe kánkán láti sáré sínú ìwà búburú, ẹlẹ́rìí èké tí ń gbé irọ́ yọ, àti ẹnikẹ́ni tí ń dá asọ̀ sílẹ̀ láàárín àwọn arákùnrin.”—Òwe 6:16-19.
Solomon states: “There are six things that Jehovah does hate; yes, seven are things detestable to his soul: lofty eyes, a false tongue, and hands that are shedding innocent blood, a heart fabricating hurtful schemes, feet that are in a hurry to run to badness, a false witness that launches forth lies, and anyone sending forth contentions among brothers.” —Proverbs 6:16-19.
jw2019
Họ́wù, ńṣe nírú ẹni bẹ́ẹ̀ máa ń dẹ́kun híhu irú ìwà wọ̀nyẹn!
Why, that person is moved to exclude such practices from his life!
jw2019
Àwọn ìpètepèrò ẹni búburú jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn àsọjáde dídùn mọ́ni jẹ́ èyí tí ó mọ́.
The schemes of the bad one are something detestable to Jehovah, but pleasant sayings are clean.
jw2019

hinduism is the translation of "hinduism" into English. Sample translated sentence: Nínú ìwé rẹ̀ Hinduism: Its Meaning for the Liberation of the Spirit, ọlọ́gbọ́n èrò orí tí ó jẹ́ ẹlẹ́sìn Híńdù, Nikhilananda, sọ pé ‘èrò níní ìrírí lẹ́yìn ikú jẹ́ ohun tí kò bọ́gbọ́n mu.’ ↔ In his book Hinduism: Its Meaning for the Liberation of the Spirit, Hindu philosopher Nikhilananda says that ‘experiences after death cannot be demonstrated by reason.’

examples.yoruba: Bí ó ti wù kí ó rí, rá ntí ohun tí Jesu sọ pé: 'Híhá ni ẹnu-ọ̀nà náà, à ti tó óró ni ojú-ọ̀nà náà, tí ó lọ sí ibi ìyè, díẹ̀ ni à wọn ẹni tí ó ń rìn ín.' —Matteu 7: 13, 14.
examples.english: However, recall what Jesus said: “Narrowis the gate and cramped the road leading off into life, and few are the ones finding it.” —Matthew 7:13, 14.

examples.yoruba: Ọwọ́híhá àh ájù ní ń dínà ire mọ́ni.
examples.english: Excessive stinginess is what slams the door of fortune in one's face.

examples.yoruba: Jésù sọ pé: “Ẹ gba ẹnubodè tó óró wọlé; níto rí fífẹ̀ à ti alá yè gbígbòòrò ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìparun, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń gbà á wọlé; nígbà tí ó jẹ́ pé, tó óró ni ẹnubodè náà, híhá sì ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìyè, díẹ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń rí i.”—Má tíù 7:13, 14.
examples.english: Jesus said: “Go in through thenarrowgate; because broad and spacious is the road leading off into destruction, and many are the ones going in through it; whereasnarrowis the gate and cramped the road leading off into life, and few are the ones finding it.” —Matthew 7:13, 14.

examples.yoruba: Nínú Ìwà ásù olókìkí tí Jésù ṣe Lórí Òkè, ó sọ pé: “Ẹ gba ẹnubodè tó óró wọlé; níto rí fífẹ̀ à ti alá yè gbígbòòrò ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìparun, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń gbà á wọlé; nígbà tí ó jẹ́ pé, tó óró ni ẹnubodè náà, híhá sì ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìyè, díẹ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń rí i.”
examples.english: In his famous Sermon on the Mount, Jesus said: “Go in through thenarrowgate; because broad and spacious is the road leading off into destruction, and many are the ones going in through it; whereasnarrowis the gate and cramped the road leading off into life, and few are the ones finding it.”

examples.yoruba: Ó sọ pé: “Fífẹ̀ à ti alá yè gbígbòòrò ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìparun, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń gbà á wọlé; nígbà tí ó jẹ́ pé, tó óró ni ẹnubodè náà, híhá sì ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìyè, díẹ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń rí i.”—Má tíù 7:13, 14.
examples.english: He said: “Broad and spacious is the road leading off into destruction, and many are the ones going in through it; whereasnarrowis the gate and cramped the road leading off into life, and few are the ones finding it.” —Matthew 7:13, 14.

examples.yoruba: JÉSÙ sọ pé: “Ẹ gba ẹnubodè tó óró wọlé; níto rí fífẹ̀ à ti alá yè gbígbòòrò ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìparun, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń gbà á wọlé; nígbà tí ó jẹ́ pé, tó óró ni ẹnubodè náà, híhá sì ni ojú ọ̀nà tí ó lọ sínú ìyè, díẹ̀ sì ni à wọn tí ń rí i.”
examples.english: “GO IN through thenarrowgate,” Jesus said, “because broad and spacious is the road leading off into destruction, and many are the ones going in through it; whereasnarrowis the gate and cramped the road leading off into life, and few are the ones finding it.”

examples.yoruba: Níwọ̀n ìgbà táa bá ṣì láǹfà àní à tibá ara wa kẹ́gbẹ́, táa sì lá gb ára à tiṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, a ò gbọ́dọ̀ gbìyà njú à tidá nìkan rin ojú ọ̀nà híhán áà tó lọ sí ìyè.—Òwe 18:1; Má tíù 7:14.
examples.english: As long as we are free and able to associate with one another, we must not try to walk alone along thecrampedroadleading offinto life. —Proverbs 18:1; Matthew 7:14.

examples.yoruba: Lá ti lè múhíhá àwọn òfin à tẹnudẹ́nu sórí rọrùn, wọ́n gé òfin tà bí à ṣà kọ̀ọ̀kan kúrú sí gbólóhùn ṣókí, tí ó mọ níwọ̀n.
examples.english: To facilitatememorizationof oral traditions, each ruling or tradition was reduced to a brief, concise phrase.

examples.yoruba: Ọ̀ràn ẹ̀tọ́ ìwà híhù lóríhíhá wọn mọ́ tún wà níbẹ̀, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ lọ́nà onípẹ̀lẹ́tù.
examples.english: There is also theethicalaspect of keeping them confined, even though humanely.

examples.yoruba: Ètò ìgbókèèrè-ṣà kóso, ìṣòwò lá àárín à wọn orílẹ̀-èdè, à tihíhá èèyàn mọ́ à wọn à gọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ ti mú kí à wọn èèyàn ronú pé ó yẹ kí à wọn ṣínà ìjùmọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ níto rí pé wọn ò gbédè ara wọn.
examples.english: Colonization, trade between countries, and evenconfinementin concentration camps have caused people to feel the need to bridge the communication gap because of having no language in common.

Ní tòótọ́ Àwọn Ará Tó Wà Níṣọ̀kan yìí, tàbí àwọn Ará Nílẹ̀ Czech, gẹ́gẹ́ bá a tún ṣe ń pe àwọn onígbàgbọ́ yìí lẹ́yìn náà, wá ‘ojú ọ̀nà híhá tí ó lọ sínú ìyè.’
Indeed, this Unity of Brethren, or the Czech Brethren, as this community of believers came to be called, searched for the ‘cramped road leading to life.’

Níwọ̀n ìgbà táa bá ṣì láǹfààní àtibá ara wa kẹ́gbẹ́, táa sì lágbára àtiṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, a ò gbọ́dọ̀ gbìyànjú àtidá nìkan rin ojú ọ̀nà híhá náà tó lọ sí ìyè.—Òwe 18:1; Mátíù 7:14.
As long as we are free and able to associate with one another, we must not try to walk alone along the cramped road leading off into life. —Proverbs 18:1; Matthew 7:14.

To facilitate memorization of oral traditions, each ruling or tradition was reduced to a brief, concise phrase.

However, recall what Jesus said: “Narrow is the gate and cramped the road leading off into life, and few are the ones finding it.” —Matthew 7:13, 14.

Ọ̀ràn ẹ̀tọ́ ìwà híhù lórí híhá wọn mọ́ tún wà níbẹ̀, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ lọ́nà onípẹ̀lẹ́tù.
There is also the ethical aspect of keeping them confined, even though humanely.
jw2019
Ọwọ́ híhá àhájù ní ń dínà ire mọ́ni.
Excessive stinginess is what slams the door of fortune in one's face.

Ó ṣeé ṣe kó o rántí pé, lákòókò kan, Jésù sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ojú ọ̀nà méjì, ìyẹn ‘ojú ọ̀nà fífẹ̀ àti aláyè gbígbòòrò tí ó lọ sínú ìparun’ àti ‘ojú ọ̀nà híhá tí ó lọ sínú ìyè.’
You perhaps recall that Jesus once spoke of two roads, a “broad and spacious . . . road leading off into destruction” and a “cramped . . . road leading off into life.”

Without them, walking on the cramped road leading to life would be more difficult.

Translations of "Haúsá" into English in sentences, translation memory

Ní Nàìjíríà nìkan, a ṣètò fún 108 àpéjọpọ̀—46 ní èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, àti 62 ní àwọn èdè mẹ́rìnlá mìíràn tí ó jẹ́ Abua, Èdè Adití Lọ́nà ti Amẹ́ríkà, Ègùn, Edo, Ẹ́fíìkì, Gòkánà, Haúsá, Ìgbò, Ijaw, Ísókó, Khana, Tiv, Urhobo, àti Yorùbá.
Of the 198 gatherings scheduled in the United States alone, 151 are in English, 36 in Spanish, and 11 in eight other languages, including American Sign Language, Chinese, French, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Tagalog, And Vietnamese.
jw2019
Ní ọ̀kan lára àwọn ọjà tó wà nílùú Douala, àwọn Haúsá àtàwọn Fúlàní ló ni ìsọ̀ tó pọ̀ jù lọ níbẹ̀.
In one of Douala’s markets, many of the stallholders belong to the Hausa and the Fula peoples.
jw2019
John pẹ̀lú borí ẹ̀tanú tó ní sí ọmọ Haúsá tí wọ́n jọ wà ní kíláàsì.
John overcame his prejudice toward his Hausa classmate.
jw2019
Bí John, tó jẹ́ ọmọ Íbò lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ṣe borí ẹ̀tanú tó ní sí àwọn Haúsá nìyẹn.
This was how John, a Nigerian of the Ibo people, overcame his prejudice against the Hausa people.
jw2019
Ó rántí ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀, ó sọ pé: “Nígbà tí mi ò tíì pé ọmọ ogún ọdún, mo bá àwọn Haúsá kan pàdé, a sì dọ̀rẹ́ ara wa.
“As a teenager,” he recalls, “I met some Hausa students who became my friends.
jw2019

examples.yoruba: Kí à wọn ìjọ tí ìwé ìkésíni púpọ̀ bá ṣẹ́ kù sí lọ́wọ́ fi wọ́n há ẹnu ọ̀nà à wọn tí kò sí nílé ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ká ngun sí ìgbà Ìrá ntí Ikú Kristi, à mọ́ kò gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ ṣá ájú ìgbà náà.
examples.english: Congregations that have a generous supply of invitations left over mayleavethem at not-at-homes during the last week before the Memorial, but not before that.

examples.yoruba: 13 Àwọn ọmọ kan tí wọn ò tíì mọ̀wéé kà máa ń háàwọn orin Ìjọba tí a ó kọ ní à wọn ìpà dé lọ́sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ sórí.
examples.english: 13 Some children who cannot yet readmemorizethe lyrics of the Kingdom songs that will be used at the meetings each week.

examples.yoruba: Lẹ́yìn náà, ẹni tí ó gbé ìròyìn yìí já de mẹ́nu kan à wọn ohun tí a kì í sá bà mẹ́nu kàn pé: “Ó jọ pé ó túbọ̀ bọ́gbọ́n mu lá ti ronú pé à wọn ìtẹ̀sí à rà màǹdà kanhá sáà árín ìlà nà náà, bóyá nínú ìgbésẹ̀ agbá ra à mọ̀ọ́mọ̀-ṣe-nǹkan, tí ó sì jẹ́ olóye, tí ó mú kí à gbá álá ayé ṣe gẹ́ẹ́ ní ìmúrasílẹ̀ fún dídé wa.”
examples.english: The author of this report then mentioned the usually unmentionable: “It seems more reasonable to assume that some mysterious bias lurks within the process, perhaps in the action of an intelligent and intentional power who fine-tuned the universe in preparation for our arrival.”

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí mo wà ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n Vladimir ni mo wá mọyì ohun tí Pọ́ọ̀lù sọ, pé: “Ahá wa gá díg ádí ní gbogbo ọ̀nà, ṣùgbọ́n a kòhá wa ré kọjá yíyíra; ọkàn wa dà rú, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe lá ìsí ọ̀nà à bá jáde rá rá.”
examples.english: Especially while I was in Vladimir Prison did I identify with the apostle Paul's words about being “pressed in every way, but notcrampedbeyond movement,” and “perplexed, but not absolutely with no way out.”

examples.yoruba: Bi a ṣe kọja araawa bayii loju ọ̀nà ẹlẹ́sẹ̀ ti ohá gádíg ádí naa, mo fẹrẹẹ má lè gba ohun ti ń ṣẹlẹ gbọ́.
examples.english: As we shuffled past one another on thecrampedpathway, I could hardly believe what was happening.

examples.yoruba: Àìsàn, ojú ọjọ́ tí kò dáa, tà bí òfin kó-nílé-gbélé lèh áọ mọ́lé.
examples.english: Sickness, bad weather, or a curfew may at timesconfineyou to your home.

examples.yoruba: Níto rí náà, a ò gbọ́dọ̀ wá sọ ọ́ di dandan mọ́ra wa lọ́wọ́ lá ti má ah áàwọn à bá náà sórí ká lè sọ ọ́ gẹ́lẹ́ bó ṣe wà níbẹ̀.
examples.english: Therefore, we should not feel obligated to presentthemagazines exactly as worded in the sample presentations.

examples.yoruba: Lóòótọ́, nínú ayé tí ọwọ́há gádíg ádí yìí, ọkọ lè lo à kókò tí ó pọ̀ níta, nídìí iṣẹ́, ìṣúnná owó sì lè mú kí à wọn aya kan wá iṣẹ́ síta pẹ̀lú.
examples.english: True, in thesebusytimes, husbands may work long hours outside the home, and economic circumstances may result in some wives holding a job also.

examples.yoruba: Wọ́n kó Ruth Danner lọ sínú à gọ́ pẹ̀lú à wọn òbí rẹ̀ nígbà tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́sàn-án, wọ́n sìh áa mọ́ à gọ́ mẹ́fà ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
examples.english: Ruth Danner was deported at the age of nine along with her parents and wasinterned insix different camps.

examples.yoruba: Ó tún ti kọ lẹ́tà kan tí a máa ń fihá ẹnu ọ̀nà à wọn ènìyàn tí wọn kò bá sí nílé.
examples.english: She has also prepared a letter that we leave at thedoorwhen no one is at home.

examples.yoruba: Àmọ́ ṣá o, tí ìpínlẹ̀ ìwà ásù yín bá tó bi, à wọn alà gbà lè pinnu pé kẹ́ ẹ máa dọ́gbọ́n fi ìwé ìkésínihá ẹnu ọ̀nà à wọn tẹ́ ò bá bá nílé.
examples.english: However, if you have a large territory, the elders may determine that invitations can be left discreetly at not-at-homes.

examples.yoruba: Ìròyìn Ìwé Mímọ́ sọ pé: “Àwọn ahọ́n bí ti iná sì di rírí fún wọn a sìhá wọn ká àki ri, ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan sì bà lé ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan wọn, gbogbo wọ́n sì wá kún fún ẹ̀mí mímọ́ wọ́n sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í fi onírúurú ahọ́n à jèjì sọ̀rọ̀, gan-an gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀mí ti ń yọ̀ǹda fún wọn lati sọ̀rọ̀ já de.”—Ìṣe 2:1-4.
examples.english: Says the Scriptural account: “Tongues as if of fire became visible to them and weredistributedabout, and one sat upon each one of them, and they all became filled with holy spirit and started to speak with different tongues, just as the spirit was granting them to make utterance.”—Acts 2:1-4.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn ọmọ míì tíẹ̀há àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ orin yẹn sórí tí wọ́n sì ń fi ìdùnnú kọ ọ́.
examples.english: Some children evenmemorizedthe words of the songs in this series and sang them happily.

examples.english: 4 To someone who feelstrappedin a hostile or loveless marriage, Jehovah's standard may seem harsh and unreasonable.

examples.english: “Sometimes when I don't have time to put my clothes away, things I need find a way of getting lostunderall the mess!” —Mandy.

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, à wọn ènìyàn orílẹ̀-èdè búburú yẹn lè ka ìkìlọ̀ mi sí ewu kan, wọ́n sì lè ṣẹ́gun Israeli!
examples.english: Why, people of that wicked nation may consider my warning a threat and conquer Israel!

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, gbogbo ọgbọ́n tí ará yé ti kójọ já lẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀-ìtàn rẹ̀ jẹ́ ìwọ̀n bíń tín nígbà tí a bá fiwéra pẹ̀lú ìtọ́ni à tọ̀runwá tí a gbékarí ọgbọ́n alá ìlópin ti Jehofa.
examples.english: Why, all the worldly wisdom of the ages amounts to little when compared with divine instruction based on Jehovah's infinite wisdom.

examples.yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti rí ní ọ̀pọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè míràn, họ́wùhọ́wù ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti bẹ́ sílẹ̀ ní Itali.
examples.english: As in many other countries, a bloodscandalhas erupted in Italy.

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Jóòbù 12:7 ti wí, kódà “à wọn ẹran agbéléjẹ̀” à ti “à wọn ẹ̀dá abìyẹ́lá pá” pà ápàá lè kọ́ni lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ bí wọn kò tilẹ̀ lè fọhùn!
examples.english: Why, according to Job 12:7, even “domestic animals” and “winged creatures” can teach silently!

examples.yoruba: Ní ti Mèsá yà, ẹni tí a “tẹ́ń bẹ́lú nínú ọkàn,” tí “orílẹ̀-èdè ń ṣehọ́ọ̀ sí,” ìlérí tí Jèhófà ṣe ni pé: “Àwọn ọba tìká ra wọn yóò rí i, wọn yóò sì dìde dá júd ájú, à ti à wọn ọmọ alá dé, wọn yóò sì tẹrí ba, níto rí Jèhófà, ẹni tí ó jẹ́ olùṣòtítọ́, Ẹni Mímọ́ Ísírẹ́lì, ẹni tí ó yàn ọ́.”—Aísá yà 49:7.
examples.english: Regarding the Messiah, who is “despised in soul” and “detestedby the nation,” Jehovah promises: “Kings themselves will see and certainly rise up, and princes, and they will bow down, by reason of Jehovah, who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel, who chooses you.” —Isaiah 49:7.

examples.yoruba: Lẹ́yìn gbogbo ohun tí ó sì ti dé bá wa níto rí à wọn iṣẹ́ búburú wa à ti ẹ̀bi ń láǹlà wa—níto rí pé ìwọ fúnra rẹ, ìwọ Ọlọ́run wa, ti ka ìṣìnà wa sí kékeré ju bí ó ti yẹ lọ, ìwọ sì ti fún wa ní à wọn tí ó sá à sá là, bí à wọn wọ̀nyí—ǹjẹ́ ó yẹ kí a tún máa rú à wọn à ṣẹ rẹ, kí a sì máa bá à wọn ènìyàn tí ń ṣe à wọn ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí wọ̀nyí dá na?
examples.english: And after all that has come upon us for our bad deeds and our great guiltiness —for you yourself, O our God, have underestimated our error, and you have given us those who have escaped such as these— shall we go breaking your commandments again and forming marriage alliances with the peoples of thesedetestable things?

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, jẹ́ ká tibi ìrètí à jíǹde wò ó.
examples.english: Just think, though, about the resurrection.

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, “lá ti kó wọn jọ pa pọ̀ sí ogun ọjọ́ ń lá Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè”!
examples.english: Why, “to gather them together to the war of the great day of God the Almighty”!

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, iye tí ó lé ní 34,000 ní ó pésẹ̀ ní à wọn ìlú ń lá mẹ́jọ, tí à wọn 2,260 sì ṣèrìbọmi!
examples.english: Why, over 34,000 attended in eight cities, and 2,260 were baptized!

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, ìdà gbàsókè tí ó wúnilórí, tí ó sì nítumọ̀ jùlọ ní ayé ń ṣẹlẹ̀ níhìn-ín gan-an nínú ètò-à jọ Jehofa!
examples.english: Why, the most exciting, meaningful developments in the world happen right here within Jehovah's organization!

examples.yoruba: (Má tíù 7:1) Gbogbo à wa tá a wà nínú ìjọ ní lá ti ṣọ́ra ká má bàa dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀ níto rí à wọn ọ̀ràn tó jẹ mọ́ ẹ̀rí ọkàn ká lukú.
examples.english: (Matthew 7:1) All in the congregation want to avoid makinganissue of personal matters of conscience.

examples.yoruba: Sólómọ́nì sọ pé: “Ohun mẹ́fà ní ń bẹ tí Jèhófà kórìíra ní tòótọ́; bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, méje ni ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí fún ọkàn rẹ̀: ojú gíga fíofío, ahọ́n èké, à ti ọwọ́ tí ń ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ alá ìmọwọ́-mẹsẹ̀ sílẹ̀, ọkàn-à yà tí ń fẹ̀tàn hùmọ̀ à wọn ìpètepèrò tí ń ṣeni lọ́ṣẹ́, ẹsẹ̀ tí ń ṣe ká nk án lá ti sá ré sínú ìwà búburú, ẹlẹ́rìí èké tí ń gbé irọ́ yọ, à ti ẹnikẹ́ni tí ń dá asọ̀ sílẹ̀ lá àárín à wọn ará kùnrin.”—Òwe 6:16-19.
examples.english: Solomon states: “There are six things that Jehovah does hate; yes, seven are thingsdetestableto his soul: lofty eyes, a false tongue, and hands that are shedding innocent blood, a heart fabricating hurtful schemes, feet that are in a hurry to run to badness, a false witness that launches forth lies, and anyone sending forth contentions among brothers.” —Proverbs 6:16-19.

examples.yoruba: Họ́wù, ń ṣe nírú ẹni bẹ́ẹ̀ máa ń dẹ́kun híhu irú ìwà wọ̀nyẹn!
examples.english: Why, that person is moved to exclude such practices from his life!

examples.yoruba: Àwọn ìpètepèrò ẹni búburú jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n à wọn à sọjá de dídùn mọ́ni jẹ́ èyí tí ó mọ́.
examples.english: The schemes of the bad one aresomething detestableto Jehovah, but pleasant sayings are clean.

examples.english: hong kong

examples.english: Nítorí gbogbo àwọn tí ń ṣe nǹkan wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà.”For whoever does these things isdetestableto Jehovah.”jw2019

examples.yoruba: Òǹkọ̀wé Vatican náà, Luigi Accattoli, sọ pé: “Ìjẹ́wọ́ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn kókó tí ń dáhọ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀ jù lọ nínú Ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì Kátólíìkì
examples.english: “The confession of sin is one of the most controversial subjects within the Catholic Church,” says Vatican commentator Luigi Accattoli.

examples.english: For whoever does these things isdetestableto Jehovah.”

examples.english: Họ́wù, láti ọjọ́ tí àwọn baba ńlá wa ti sùn nínú ikú, ohun gbogbo ń bá a lọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti rí láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀pẹ̀pẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀dá.”—2 Pétérù 3:4.Why, from the day our forefathers fell asleep in death, all things are continuing exactly as from creation’s beginning.” —2 Peter 3:4.jw2019

examples.yoruba: Nítorí gbogbo àwọn tí ń ṣe nǹkan wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ní tìtorí ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí wọ̀nyí sì ni Jèhófà Ọlọ́run rẹ yóò fi lé wọn lọ kúrò níwájú rẹ
examples.english: For everybody doing these things is somethingdetestableto Jehovah, and on account of thesedetestablethings Jehovah your God is driving them away from before you.”

examples.english: 5 Bóyá o ń ronú níbi tí a dé yìí pé: ‘Họ́wù, mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ ìdílé mi, ṣùgbọ́n kò rí bí irú èyí tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ júwe tán yìí.5 Perhaps at this point you are thinking: ‘Well, I love my family, but it is not like the one just described.jw2019

examples.english: 5 Perhaps at this point you are thinking: ‘Well, I love my family, but it is not like the one just described.

examples.english: They do not weep, cut their hair, or wear sackcloth as a sign of repentance.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí Sólómọ́nì ń sọ ìdí tí ó fi fúnni ní àwọn àmọ̀ràn rẹ̀, ó ní: “Nítorí oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán
examples.english: Summing up the reason for his counsel, Solomon says: “For the devious person is adetestable thingto Jehovah, but His intimacy is with the upright ones.

examples.yoruba: (Efesu 4: 31, 32; Jakọbu 3: 17, 18)Họ́wù, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀dọ́ ti borí àyíká ilé búburú pàápàá, bí wọ́n ti wá láti inú ìdílé tí ìmukúmu, ìwà ipá, tàbí agbára ìdarí mìíràn tí ń pani lára, ń yọ lẹ́nu, tí wọ́n sì ti dàgbà di ẹni tí ó ní láárí
examples.english: Bíbélì sọ pé: “Oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán.” —Òwe 3:32.The Bible says: “Jehovahdetestsa devious person, but His close friendship is with the upright.” —Proverbs 3:32.jw2019

examples.yoruba: (Efesu 4: 31, 32; Jakọbu 3: 17, 18)Họ́wù, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀dọ́ ti borí àyíká ilé búburú pàápàá, bí wọ́n ti wá láti inú ìdílé tí ìmukúmu, ìwà ipá, tàbí agbára ìdarí mìíràn tí ń pani lára, ń yọ lẹ́nu, tí wọ́n sì ti dàgbà di ẹni tí ó ní láárí
examples.english: (Ephesians 4:31, 32; James 3:17, 18)Why, many youngsters have risen above even a bad home environment, coming from families marked by alcoholism, violence, or some other harmful influence, and have grown up to be fine adults.

examples.yoruba: Bíbélì sọ pé: “Oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán
examples.english: The Bible says: “Jehovahdetestsa devious person, but His close friendship is with the upright.” —Proverbs 3:32.

examples.yoruba: Kò sí ẹni tí ó lè di ìdùnnú Kristian rẹ̀ mú bí ó bá ń fi irọ́, ìṣẹ̀fẹ̀ rírùn akóninírìíra, ati awọn ọ̀ràn àìṣòdodo, àìmọ́, tí kò bá ìwàrere mú, tí ó kún fún ìkórìíra, ati ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí kún èrò-inú ati ọkàn-àyà rẹ̀

examples.yoruba: Sólómọ́nì sọ pé: “Ohun mẹ́fà ní ń bẹ tí Jèhófà kórìíra ní tòótọ́; bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, méje ni ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí fún ọkàn rẹ̀: ojú gíga fíofío, ahọ́n èké, àti ọwọ́ tí ń ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ aláìmọwọ́-mẹsẹ̀ sílẹ̀, ọkàn-àyà tí ń fẹ̀tàn hùmọ̀ àwọn ìpètepèrò tí ń ṣeni lọ́ṣẹ́, ẹsẹ̀ tí ń ṣe kánkán láti sáré sínú ìwà búburú, ẹlẹ́rìí èké tí ń gbé irọ́ yọ, àti ẹnikẹ́ni tí ń dá asọ̀ sílẹ̀ láàárín àwọn arákùnrin

Translations of "họ" into English in sentences, translation memory

Òǹkọ̀wé Vatican náà, Luigi Accattoli, sọ pé: “Ìjẹ́wọ́ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn kókó tí ń dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀ jù lọ nínú Ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì Kátólíìkì.
“The confession of sin is one of the most controversial subjects within the Catholic Church,” says Vatican commentator Luigi Accattoli.
jw2019
Nítorí gbogbo àwọn tí ń ṣe nǹkan wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà.”
For whoever does these things is detestable to Jehovah.”
jw2019
Nítorí gbogbo àwọn tí ń ṣe nǹkan wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ní tìtorí ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí wọ̀nyí sì ni Jèhófà Ọlọ́run rẹ yóò fi lé wọn lọ kúrò níwájú rẹ.”
For everybody doing these things is something detestable to Jehovah, and on account of these detestable things Jehovah your God is driving them away from before you.”
jw2019
Họ́wù, láti ọjọ́ tí àwọn baba ńlá wa ti sùn nínú ikú, ohun gbogbo ń bá a lọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti rí láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀pẹ̀pẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀dá.”—2 Pétérù 3:4.
Why, from the day our forefathers fell asleep in death, all things are continuing exactly as from creation’s beginning.” —2 Peter 3:4.
jw2019
5 Bóyá o ń ronú níbi tí a dé yìí pé: ‘Họ́wù, mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ ìdílé mi, ṣùgbọ́n kò rí bí irú èyí tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ júwe tán yìí.
5 Perhaps at this point you are thinking: ‘Well, I love my family, but it is not like the one just described.
jw2019
Wọn kò sunkún, wọn ò gé irun wọn, tàbí kí wọ́n wọ aṣọ àpò ìdọ̀họ láti fi hàn pé àwọn ronú pìwà dà.
They do not weep, cut their hair, or wear sackcloth as a sign of repentance.
jw2019
Nígbà tí Sólómọ́nì ń sọ ìdí tí ó fi fúnni ní àwọn àmọ̀ràn rẹ̀, ó ní: “Nítorí oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán.
Summing up the reason for his counsel, Solomon says: “For the devious person is a detestable thing to Jehovah, but His intimacy is with the upright ones.
jw2019
(Efesu 4: 31, 32; Jakọbu 3: 17, 18) Họ́wù, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀dọ́ ti borí àyíká ilé búburú pàápàá, bí wọ́n ti wá láti inú ìdílé tí ìmukúmu, ìwà ipá, tàbí agbára ìdarí mìíràn tí ń pani lára, ń yọ lẹ́nu, tí wọ́n sì ti dàgbà di ẹni tí ó ní láárí.
(Ephesians 4:31, 32; James 3:17, 18) Why, many youngsters have risen above even a bad home environment, coming from families marked by alcoholism, violence, or some other harmful influence, and have grown up to be fine adults.
jw2019
Bíbélì sọ pé: “Oníbékebèke jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n ìbárẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ Rẹ̀ wà pẹ̀lú àwọn adúróṣánṣán.” —Òwe 3:32.
The Bible says: “Jehovah detests a devious person, but His close friendship is with the upright.” —Proverbs 3:32.
jw2019
Kò sí ẹni tí ó lè di ìdùnnú Kristian rẹ̀ mú bí ó bá ń fi irọ́, ìṣẹ̀fẹ̀ rírùn akóninírìíra, ati awọn ọ̀ràn àìṣòdodo, àìmọ́, tí kò bá ìwàrere mú, tí ó kún fún ìkórìíra, ati ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí kún èrò-inú ati ọkàn-àyà rẹ̀.
No one can maintain Christian joy if he fills his mind and heart with lies, foolish jesting, and matters that are unrighteous, immoral, without virtue, hateful, and detestable.
jw2019
(Róòmù 7:21; Éfésù 4:31) Kí làwọn nǹkan míì tó tún lè dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀?
(Romans 7:21; Ephesians 4:31) What other factors might cause tension?
jw2019
Họ́wù, àwọn ènìyàn orílẹ̀-èdè búburú yẹn lè ka ìkìlọ̀ mi sí ewu kan, wọ́n sì lè ṣẹ́gun Israeli!
Why, people of that wicked nation may consider my warning a threat and conquer Israel!
jw2019
Họ́wù, gbogbo ọgbọ́n tí aráyé ti kójọ jálẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀-ìtàn rẹ̀ jẹ́ ìwọ̀n bíńtín nígbà tí a bá fiwéra pẹ̀lú ìtọ́ni àtọ̀runwá tí a gbékarí ọgbọ́n aláìlópin ti Jehofa.
Why, all the worldly wisdom of the ages amounts to little when compared with divine instruction based on Jehovah’s infinite wisdom.
jw2019
Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti rí ní ọ̀pọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè míràn, họ́wùhọ́wù ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti bẹ́ sílẹ̀ ní Itali.
As in many other countries, a blood scandal has erupted in Italy.
jw2019
Họ́wù, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Jóòbù 12:7 ti wí, kódà “àwọn ẹran agbéléjẹ̀” àti “àwọn ẹ̀dá abìyẹ́lápá” pàápàá lè kọ́ni lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ bí wọn kò tilẹ̀ lè fọhùn!
Why, according to Job 12:7, even “domestic animals” and “winged creatures” can teach silently!
jw2019
Ní ti Mèsáyà, ẹni tí a “tẹ́ńbẹ́lú nínú ọkàn,” tí “orílẹ̀-èdè ń ṣe họ́ọ̀ sí,” ìlérí tí Jèhófà ṣe ni pé: “Àwọn ọba tìkára wọn yóò rí i, wọn yóò sì dìde dájúdájú, àti àwọn ọmọ aládé, wọn yóò sì tẹrí ba, nítorí Jèhófà, ẹni tí ó jẹ́ olùṣòtítọ́, Ẹni Mímọ́ Ísírẹ́lì, ẹni tí ó yàn ọ́.”—Aísáyà 49:7.
Regarding the Messiah, who is “despised in soul” and “detested by the nation,” Jehovah promises: “Kings themselves will see and certainly rise up, and princes, and they will bow down, by reason of Jehovah, who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel, who chooses you.” —Isaiah 49:7.
jw2019
Lẹ́yìn gbogbo ohun tí ó sì ti dé bá wa nítorí àwọn iṣẹ́ búburú wa àti ẹ̀bi ńláǹlà wa—nítorí pé ìwọ fúnra rẹ, ìwọ Ọlọ́run wa, ti ka ìṣìnà wa sí kékeré ju bí ó ti yẹ lọ, ìwọ sì ti fún wa ní àwọn tí ó sá àsálà, bí àwọn wọ̀nyí—ǹjẹ́ ó yẹ kí a tún máa rú àwọn àṣẹ rẹ, kí a sì máa bá àwọn ènìyàn tí ń ṣe àwọn ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí wọ̀nyí dána?
And after all that has come upon us for our bad deeds and our great guiltiness —for you yourself, O our God, have underestimated our error, and you have given us those who have escaped such as these— shall we go breaking your commandments again and forming marriage alliances with the peoples of these detestable things?
jw2019
Họ́wù, jẹ́ ká tibi ìrètí àjíǹde wò ó.
Just think, though, about the resurrection.
jw2019
Họ́wù, “láti kó wọn jọ pa pọ̀ sí ogun ọjọ́ ńlá Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè”!
Why, “to gather them together to the war of the great day of God the Almighty”!
jw2019
Họ́wù, iye tí ó lé ní 34,000 ní ó pésẹ̀ ní àwọn ìlú ńlá mẹ́jọ, tí àwọn 2,260 sì ṣèrìbọmi!
Why, over 34,000 attended in eight cities, and 2,260 were baptized!
jw2019
Họ́wù, ìdàgbàsókè tí ó wúnilórí, tí ó sì nítumọ̀ jùlọ ní ayé ń ṣẹlẹ̀ níhìn-ín gan-an nínú ètò-àjọ Jehofa!
Why, the most exciting, meaningful developments in the world happen right here within Jehovah’s organization!
jw2019
(Mátíù 7:1) Gbogbo àwa tá a wà nínú ìjọ ní láti ṣọ́ra ká má bàa dá họ́wùhọ́wù sílẹ̀ nítorí àwọn ọ̀ràn tó jẹ mọ́ ẹ̀rí ọkàn kálukú.
(Matthew 7:1) All in the congregation want to avoid making an issue of personal matters of conscience.
jw2019
Sólómọ́nì sọ pé: “Ohun mẹ́fà ní ń bẹ tí Jèhófà kórìíra ní tòótọ́; bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, méje ni ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí fún ọkàn rẹ̀: ojú gíga fíofío, ahọ́n èké, àti ọwọ́ tí ń ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ aláìmọwọ́-mẹsẹ̀ sílẹ̀, ọkàn-àyà tí ń fẹ̀tàn hùmọ̀ àwọn ìpètepèrò tí ń ṣeni lọ́ṣẹ́, ẹsẹ̀ tí ń ṣe kánkán láti sáré sínú ìwà búburú, ẹlẹ́rìí èké tí ń gbé irọ́ yọ, àti ẹnikẹ́ni tí ń dá asọ̀ sílẹ̀ láàárín àwọn arákùnrin.”—Òwe 6:16-19.
Solomon states: “There are six things that Jehovah does hate; yes, seven are things detestable to his soul: lofty eyes, a false tongue, and hands that are shedding innocent blood, a heart fabricating hurtful schemes, feet that are in a hurry to run to badness, a false witness that launches forth lies, and anyone sending forth contentions among brothers.” —Proverbs 6:16-19.
jw2019
Họ́wù, ńṣe nírú ẹni bẹ́ẹ̀ máa ń dẹ́kun híhu irú ìwà wọ̀nyẹn!
Why, that person is moved to exclude such practices from his life!
jw2019
Àwọn ìpètepèrò ẹni búburú jẹ́ ohun ìṣe-họ́ọ̀-sí lójú Jèhófà, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn àsọjáde dídùn mọ́ni jẹ́ èyí tí ó mọ́.
The schemes of the bad one are something detestable to Jehovah, but pleasant sayings are clean.
jw2019

examples.yoruba: (Human Rights WatchWorld Report 1998) Ìwà ipá nínú ilé, tó tàn ká lẹ̀ rẹ́kẹrẹ̀kẹ, ṣùgbọ́n tí a kì í sá bàá sọ síta, ni ìṣòro táa wá ń pè ní “rògbòdìyàn mẹ́numọ́ bá yìí ní ọ̀rúndún ogún yìí.”—The Globe and Mail, lá ti ilẹ̀ Ká nádà.
examples.english: (Human Rights Watch World Report 1998) Domestic violence, being a widespread yet underreported problem, is now called “the silent crisis of the 20th century.” —The Globe and Mail, Canada.

examples.yoruba: Nepal: “Ìwà kẹ́lẹ́yà mẹ̀yà tí wọ́n ń hù sá wọn ẹlẹ́sìn Híń dù kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Dalit (tó túmọ̀ sí ẹlẹ́gbin) burú jáì débi pé wọn kì í bá wọn da òwò pọ̀ rá rá, wọn kì í fẹ́ rí wọn lá wùjọ tà bí kí wọ́n tiẹ̀ fara mọ́ à ṣà wọn.”—Ìròyìn à gbá yé ọdún 2012 tó wà nínú ìwéHuman Rights Watch.
examples.english: Nepal: “Dalits (“untouchables”) suffer from endemic discrimination, especially in the economic, social, and cultural spheres.” —Human Rights Watch World Report, 2012.

examples.yoruba: Ó sì wí fún wọn pé: 'A ti kọ̀wé rẹ̀ pé, “Ilé mi ni a óò máa pè ní ilé à dúrà,” ṣùgbọ́n ẹ ń sọ ọ́ dihòròà wọn ọlọ́ṣà.'” —Mát.
examples.english: And he said to them: 'It is written, “My house will be called a house of prayer,” but you are making it acaveof robbers.'” —Matt.

examples.yoruba: Ìdí ni pé wọ́n ti sọ ilé Jèhófà di “ilé ọjà títà” à ti “hòròà wọn ọlọ́ṣà.”—Jòhá nù 2:13-16; Má tíù 21:12, 13.
examples.english: Because they were turning Jehovah's house into “a house of merchandise” and “acaveof robbers.” —John 2:13-16; Matthew 21:12, 13.

examples.yoruba: Kà kà bẹ́ẹ̀, à wọn aṣá ájú ìsìn ní ọjọ́ Jésù sọ tẹ́ń pìlì náà di “ilé ọjà títà” à ti “hòròà wọn ọlọ́ṣà.”
examples.english: Instead, the religious leaders in Jesus' day turned the temple into “a house of merchandise” and “acaveof robbers.”

examples.yoruba: 2 Ibi tó ká jọ sí lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ẹnuhòròkan lórí Òkè Hórébù, ló ti rí onírúurú ohun à rà mérìíyìí rí tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀.
examples.english: 2 As he huddled near the mouth of acaveon Mount Horeb, he witnessed a series of spectacular events.

examples.yoruba: Nínú ewu tí ó lè yọrí sí ikú, ó fara pa mọ́ fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sínú aginjù, sínúhòrò, sínú ẹ̀là à pá ta, à ti sí ilẹ̀ à jèjì.
examples.english: In mortal danger, he hid for several years in the wilderness, incaves, in crevices, and on foreign ground.

examples.yoruba: Àá rín à wọnhòròibi gẹ̀rẹ́gẹ̀rẹ́ òkè ni wọ́n kọ́ à wọn ilé wọn sí.
examples.english: They actually build their homes inside thecavesof the mountain slope.

examples.yoruba: Wọ́n kọ́ Ilé Àwọn Ajẹ́jẹ̀ẹ́ Ìnìkà ngbé ti Àpóká líìsì, tí ilé ìjọsìn kékeré ti Anne “Mímọ́” wà, ní ọdún 1090 lá ti fi dí ẹnu ọ̀nà hòròtí à ṣà à tọwọ́dọ́wọ́ sọ pé ibẹ̀ ni a ti fi à wọn ìran tí Jòhá nù rí hàn án.
examples.english: The Monastery of the Apocalypse, containing the tiny chapel of “Saint” Anne, was built in 1090 to enclose the entrance of thegrottowhere tradition has it that John received his visions.

examples.english: According to architect Pietro Laureano, their number, “far greater than that of the inhabitedcavesor than those needed for drinking water,” testifies that “the cisterns of the Sassi were originally an impressive system of water collection for irrigation.”

examples.yoruba: Òkútahòròn áà ni ó sá bà máa ń di òrùlé, ògiri ẹ̀yìn ilé, à ti ògiri ẹ̀gbẹ́ ilé.

examples.yoruba: Jésù kí gbe pé: “A ti kọ̀wé rẹ̀ pé, 'Ilé mi ni a óò máa pè ní ilé à dúrà,' ṣùgbọ́n ẹ ń sọ ọ́ dihòròà wọn ọlọ́ṣà.”—Má tíù 21:12, 13.
examples.english: “It is written,” Jesus exclaims, “'My house will be called a house of prayer,' but you are making it acaveof robbers.”—Matthew 21:12, 13.

examples.yoruba: Ní September 1994, a bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí tẹ̀wé já de ní Ilé Bẹ́tẹ́lì tó wà níHavana.

Translations of "havana" into English in sentences, translation memory

Ní September 1994, a bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí tẹ̀wé jáde ní Ilé Bẹ́tẹ́lì tó wà ní Havana.
In September 1994, a printing operation was established in the Bethel Home in Havana.
jw2019
Nígbà tí àwọn aṣojú náà gúnlẹ̀ sí pápákọ̀ òfuurufú José Martí ní Havana, àwùjọ àwọn lọ́gàálọ́gàá lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ọba àti àwọn tó ti Ilé Bẹ́tẹ́lì wá, fi tẹ̀ríntẹ̀yẹ kí wọn káàbọ̀, lára wọn ni, arákùnrin kan tó rántí ìbẹ̀wò tí ọ̀kan lára àwọn mẹ́ńbà Ẹgbẹ́ Olùṣàkóso—Milton Henschel—ṣé gbẹ̀yìn sí Cuba lọ́dún 1961.
When the delegation arrived at the José Martí airport in Havana, they were hospitably received by a contingent of public officials and a group from the Bethel Home, among them a brother who remembered the last visit to Cuba of a Governing Body member —Milton Henschel— in 1961.
jw2019
Ẹni tó jẹ́ ọ̀gá ní Yunifásítì kan ni ìlú Havana fìbànújẹ́ sọ pé: “Cuba kì í tún ṣe erékùṣù tó dá wà mọ́.
The rector of a Havana College sadly acknowledged: “Cuba is no longer an island.
jw2019
Ní alẹ́ ọjọ́ tí a dé sí Havana, olú ìlú Cuba, a jáde lọ fún iṣẹ́ ìwé ìròyìn.
The night that we arrived in Havana, Cuba’s capital, we went out in the magazine work.
jw2019
ÌGBÉSÍ AYÉ MI ÀTẸ̀YÌNWÁ: Ìlú Havana ní orílẹ̀-èdè Cuba, ni wọ́n bí mi sí, àdúgbò àwọn tálákà, tí wọ́n ti máa ń ja ìjà ìgboro gan-an, ni mo sì gbé dàgbà.
MY PAST: I was born in Havana, Cuba, and was raised in a poor neighborhood where street brawls were common.
jw2019
Láti December 1 sí 7, 1998, Lloyd Barry, John Barr, àti Gerrit Lösch ti ṣèbẹ̀wò sí Ilé Bẹ́tẹ́lì ní Havana, wọ́n sì tún lọ sí díẹ̀ lára àwọn Àpéjọpọ̀ Àgbègbè “Ọ̀nà Ìgbésí Ayé Tí Ọlọ́run Fẹ́” tó wáyé ní Cuba.
From December 1 to 7, 1998, Lloyd Barry, John Barr, and Gerrit Lösch visited the Bethel Home in Havana and attended some of the “God’s Way of Life” District Conventions held in Cuba.
jw2019
Ẹnì kan tó ń gbé nílùú Havana, ní orílẹ̀-èdè Cuba sọ fún àlejò kan tó wá láti Àríwá Amẹ́ríkà pé: “A fẹ́ràn bí àwọn ará Amẹ́ríkà ṣe máa ń ṣe gan-an.
“We love U.S. culture,” explained a resident of Havana, Cuba, to a North American visitor.
jw2019
Ní àpéjọpọ̀ tí a ṣe ní Havana, a gbẹ́ ọ̀rọ̀ “Sáàmù 133:1” sára ọ̀kan lára àwọn òkúta tó wà ní àbáwọlé.
At the Havana convention site, engraved on one of the entry stones was the citation “Psalm 133:1.”
jw2019
Ní January 27, 2019, ìjì líle kan jà nílùú Havana tó jẹ́ olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè Cuba.
On January 27, 2019, a tornado pummeled Havana, the capital of Cuba.
Menyo20k
Ní Friday, May 18, 2018, ọkọ̀ òfuurufú kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Boeing 737 já bọ́ láìpẹ́ sígbà tó gbéra nílùú Havana lórílẹ̀-èdè Cuba.
On Friday, May 18, 2018, a Boeing 737 crashed shortly after takeoff from Havana, Cuba.
Menyo20k
A dúró sí Havana títí tí ó fi ṣeé ṣe fún wa láti rílé ní Santa Clara.
We stayed in Havana until we were able to locate a home in Santa Clara.
jw2019

Even if this struggle had ultimately failed to defeat Hitler and prevent all of his many crimes, it would in this view have raised the moral prestige of the Church immeasurably.
jw2019
Bó bá jẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀, kò di dandan kíwọ náà hùwà búburú tí òbí ẹ hù!
If so, you don’t have to repeat your parent’s mistakes!
jw2019
Aṣáájú-ọ̀nà náà ṣí ìwé Bíbélì Fi Kọ́ni sí orí kìíní ó sì ka ìpínrọ̀ kọkànlá fún un, èyí tó wà lábẹ́ àkòrí kékeré náà “Ojú Wo Ni Ọlọ́run Fi Ń Wo Ìwà ìrẹ́jẹ Táwọn Èèyàn Ń Hù?”
The pioneer opened the Bible Teach book to chapter 1 and read aloud paragraph 11, under the subhead “How Does God Feel About Injustices We Face?”
jw2019
(Jòhánù 17:6) Yàtọ̀ sí pé ká kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa Ọlọ́run, a tún gbọ́dọ̀ máa fi àwọn ohun tá à ń kọ́ ṣèwà hù.
(John 17:6) We must not only take in knowledge of God but also act in harmony with that knowledge.
jw2019

examples.english: “It came after a moderate-sized flare—an explosion of hydrogen andheliumabove the Sun's surface—was detected in July 1996,” reports The Daily Telegraph of London.

examples.yoruba: Bíi ti Júpítà, wọ́n ronú pé gá àsìheliumàti hydrogen ló wà nínú à wọn pílá nẹ́ẹ̀tì yẹn.
examples.english: Like Jupiter, the planets are thought to be composed ofheliumand hydrogen.

examples.yoruba: Lọ́hùn-ún nínú oòrùn òwúrọ̀, èròjà hydrogen ń wọnúheliumní à rà ádọ́ta ọ̀kẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìgbóná òun ìtutù.

examples.yoruba: Lá àárín ìṣẹ́jú díẹ̀ à kọ́kọ́ tí ìbúgbàù ń lá náà ṣẹlẹ̀, ìsopọ̀ náà ṣẹlẹ̀ ká àki ri à gbá álá ayé, ní ṣíṣokùnfà ìpọ̀rẹpẹtẹ hydrogen à tiheliumtí a wọ̀n wò lá ìpẹ́ yìí, à ti, ó kéré tán, apá kan lithium inú gbalasa òfuurufú à á rín à wọn ìrà wọ̀.

Translations of "helium" into English in sentences, translation memory

Ìwé ìròyìn The Daily Telegraph ti London ròyìn pé: “Ó ṣẹlẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n ṣàwárí ipá alágbára kan tí ó mọ níwọ̀n, tó tú jáde láti Oòrùn, ó jẹ́ lára gáàsì hydrogen àti helium—ní July 1996.”
“It came after a moderate-sized flare—an explosion of hydrogen and helium above the Sun’s surface—was detected in July 1996,” reports The Daily Telegraph of London.
jw2019
Bíi ti Júpítà, wọ́n ronú pé gáàsì helium àti hydrogen ló wà nínú àwọn pílánẹ́ẹ̀tì yẹn.
Like Jupiter, the planets are thought to be composed of helium and hydrogen.
jw2019
Lọ́hùn-ún nínú oòrùn òwúrọ̀, èròjà hydrogen ń wọnú helium ní àràádọ́ta ọ̀kẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìgbóná òun ìtutù.
Deep inside the morning sun, hydrogen is being fused into helium at temperatures of millions of degrees.
jw2019
Láàárín ìṣẹ́jú díẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ tí ìbúgbàù ńlá náà ṣẹlẹ̀, ìsopọ̀ náà ṣẹlẹ̀ káàkiri àgbáálá ayé, ní ṣíṣokùnfà ìpọ̀rẹpẹtẹ hydrogen àti helium tí a wọ̀n wò láìpẹ́ yìí, àti, ó kéré tán, apá kan lithium inú gbalasa òfuurufú àárín àwọn ìràwọ̀.
During the first few minutes of the big bang, nuclear fusion took place on a universal scale, giving rise to the currently measured concentrations of hydrogen and helium and at least part of the lithium in interstellar space.
jw2019

Àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ nípa ìparun Jerúsálẹ́mù jẹ́ ká rí i kedere pé Jèhófà jẹ́ Ọlọ́run tó máa ń ‘jẹ́ kí àwọn èèyàn rẹ̀ mọ̀ nípa àwọn ohun tuntun kí wọ́n tó ṣẹlẹ̀.’—Aísáyà 42:9.
The prophecy regarding the destruction of Jerusalem clearly portrays Jehovah as a God who ‘causes his people to know new things before they begin to spring up.’ —Isaiah 42:9.
jw2019
Ọmọbìnrin Jerúsálẹ́mù mi orí rẹ̀ sí ọ.
The daughter of Jerusalem shakes her head at you.
jw2019
èmi yóò sì fún Jerúsálẹ́mù ní olùmú ìhìn rere wá.
and to Jerusalem I shall give a bringer of good news.
jw2019
10 Níhìn-ín, Ọlọ́run bá Jerúsálẹ́mù sọ̀rọ̀ bíi pé ó jẹ́ aya àti ìyá ọlọ́mọ tó ń gbé inú àgọ́, bíi ti Sárà gẹ́lẹ́.
10 Here Jerusalem is addressed as if she were a wife and mother dwelling in tents, just like Sarah.
jw2019
Ọ̀nà jíjìn ni púpọ̀ lára àwọn tó di onígbàgbọ́ ti wá sí Jerúsálẹ́mù, wọn ò sì ní oúnjẹ tó pọ̀ tó èyí tí wọ́n á fi lè dúró pẹ́ níbẹ̀.
Many who became believers had come from faraway places and were without enough provisions to extend their stay in Jerusalem.
jw2019
Ahoro tí Jerúsálẹ́mù àti tẹ́ńpìlì rẹ̀ wà jẹ́ ẹ̀gàn fún àwọn àti Ọlọ́run wọn.
The desolate condition of Jerusalem and her temple brings reproach upon them and their God.
jw2019
(Jòhánù 8:12-59) Jésù wá kúkú jáde ní Jerúsálẹ́mù, ó sì dáwọ́ lé iṣẹ́ ìjẹ́rìí tó fakíki ní Jùdíà.
(John 8:12-59) Staying outside of Jerusalem, Jesus launches an intensive witnessing campaign in Judea.
jw2019
Àsọyé yìí ló lani lóye yékéyéké nípa bí Kirisẹ́ńdọ̀mù ṣe yapa kúrò nínú ojúlówó ẹ̀kọ́ àti ìṣe Kristẹni.
The talk graphically explained the way that Christendom had strayed from genuine Christian doctrine and practice.
jw2019
Kí àwọn akéde mú fọ́ọ̀mù kan tàbí méjì wá sí àpéjọ.
Publishers should bring one or two follow-up forms to the convention.
jw2019
Kété lẹ́yìn tí Aísáyà sọ fún Hesekáyà Ọba nípa ìparun tí ń bọ̀ wá sórí Jerúsálẹ́mù àti bí àwọn èèyàn Júù ṣe máa dèrò ìgbèkùn ní Bábílónì, ni Aísáyà gbẹ́nu lé ọ̀rọ̀ Jèhófà tó jẹ́ ìlérí nípa ìmúbọ̀sípò wọn, ó ní: “‘Ẹ tu àwọn ènìyàn mi nínú, ẹ tù wọ́n nínú,’ ni Ọlọ́run yín wí.
Immediately after telling King Hezekiah of the approaching destruction of Jerusalem and the deportation of the Jewish people to Babylon, Isaiah sets forth Jehovah’s words that promise restoration: “‘Comfort, comfort my people,’ says the God of you men.
jw2019
Ọ̀pọ̀ arìnrìn àjò mìíràn pẹ̀lú ń gòkè lọ sí Jerúsálẹ́mù fún ayẹyẹ Ìrékọjá ọdọọdún.
Many other travelers are also on their way up to Jerusalem for the annual Passover celebration.
jw2019
Ní ọdún 66 Sànmánì Tiwa, láìròtẹ́lẹ̀ àwọn ará Róòmù ké ìsàgatì wọn lórí Jerúsálẹ́mù kúrú, ní fífàyè gba àwọn “ẹran ara” Kristẹni láti sálà.
In 66 C.E., the Romans unexpectedly cut short their siege on Jerusalem, allowing Christian “flesh” to escape.
jw2019
Mo yí pa dà bìrí mo sì rí pé ìyàwó mi ti rì sínú ẹrẹ̀, ẹrẹ̀ náà sì ti mù ún dé orúnkún.
I turned and saw that Edie was standing in black mud up to her knees.
jw2019
Òpìtàn Walter Nigg ṣàlàyé pé: “Kirisẹ́ńdọ̀mù kì yóò tún rí ìbùkún gbà mọ́ àyàfi tí ó bá pàpà jẹ́wọ́—ní gbangba àti pẹ̀lú ìdánilójú tí ó jinlẹ̀—àwọn ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tí ó ṣẹ̀ nínú Ìwádìí Láti Gbógunti Àdámọ̀ náà, láìṣàbòsí, kí ó sì jáwọ́ pátápátá nínú onírúurú ìwà ipá tí ó ń hù, lórúkọ ìsìn.”
Historian Walter Nigg explains: “Christendom will experience no further blessings until it finally confesses—openly and with deep conviction—the sins committed in the Inquisition, sincerely and unconditionally renouncing every form of violence in connection with religion.”
jw2019
Àwọn tí ẹwà tẹ́ńpìlì tó wà ní Jerúsálẹ́mù ń pa bí ọtí, tí wọ́n sì ka àṣà àti òfin àtọwọ́dọ́wọ́ tó yí Òfin Mósè ká sì bàbàrà ju bó ṣe yẹ lọ, ti kùnà láti lóye ohun tí Òfin àti tẹ́ńpìlì wà fún!
Those who were mired in reverence for that lovely building in Jerusalem and for the customs and traditions that had grown up around the Mosaic Law had missed the whole purpose behind the Law and the temple!
jw2019
2:2, 3) Lọ́nà kan náà, wòlíì Sekaráyà sọ àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ pé “ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn àti àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè alágbára ńlá yóò sì wá ní ti tòótọ́ láti wá Jèhófà àwọn ẹgbẹ́ ọmọ ogun ní Jerúsálẹ́mù àti láti tu Jèhófà lójú.”
2:2, 3) Likewise, the prophet Zechariah foretold that “many peoples and mighty nations will come to seek Jehovah of armies in Jerusalem and to beg for the favor of Jehovah.”
jw2019
Kò ju oṣù mẹ́ta lọ lẹ́yìn náà tí Cestius Gallus, gómìnà ilẹ̀ Róòmù tó ń ṣàkóso ilẹ̀ Síríà, fi kó àwọn ọmọ ogun ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgbọ̀n [30,000] wọ ìlú Jerúsálẹ́mù.
Within three months, 30,000 troops appeared on the scene, led by the Roman governor of Syria, Cestius Gallus.
jw2019
Ní rírí ogunlọ́gọ̀ náà, a sún ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn tí ó ti wà ní Jerúsálẹ́mù ṣáájú láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìtọ́wọ̀ọ́rìn náà.—Mátíù 21:7-9; Jòhánù 12:12, 13.
Upon seeing the crowd, many who were already in Jerusalem were moved to join the procession.—Matthew 21:7-9; John 12:12, 13.
jw2019
+ 19 Ó sun ilé Ọlọ́run tòótọ́ kanlẹ̀,+ ó wó ògiri Jerúsálẹ́mù lulẹ̀,+ ó sun gbogbo àwọn ilé gogoro tó láàbò, ó sì ba gbogbo ohun tó ṣeyebíye jẹ́.
+ 19 He burned down the house of the true God,+ tore down the wall of Jerusalem,+ burned all its fortified towers with fire, and destroyed everything of value.
jw2019
(Kólósè 4:12) Àwọn ará nínú ìjọ tó wà ní Jerúsálẹ́mù gbàdúrà fún Pétérù nígbà tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n.
(Colossians 4:12) Members of the congregation in Jerusalem prayed for Peter when he was imprisoned.
jw2019
A lè ṣàpèjúwe ìjọ àwọn Kristẹni ẹni àmì òróró gẹ́gẹ́ bí “ọmọbìnrin Síónì” òde òní, nítorí pé “Jerúsálẹ́mù ti òkè” ni ìyá wọn.
The congregation of anointed Christians can be described as the modern-day “daughter of Zion,” since “Jerusalem above” is their mother.
jw2019
Bí àwọn aṣojú wọ̀nyí ti gbéra láti Kọ́ríńtì tí wọ́n forí lé Síríà, ìgbà Ìrékọjá ni wọn ì bá dé Jerúsálẹ́mù.
Sailing from Corinth to Syria, the delegation would have reached Jerusalem by Passover.
jw2019
2 Bí ó ṣe rí ní ọjọ́ Nehemáyà nígbà tí ọwọ́ àwọn ọmọ Ísírẹ́lì dí ní kíkọ́ ògiri Jerúsálẹ́mù ni ó ṣe rí báyìí.
2 It is now as it was in the days of Nehemiah when the Israelites were busy building Jerusalem’s wall.
jw2019
Dáfídì gbà pé Jèhófà gan-an ni Ọba Ísírẹ́lì. Ìyẹn ló fi ṣètò pé kí wọ́n gbé Àpótí Májẹ̀mú, tó jẹ́ ẹ̀rí pé Ọlọ́run wà pẹ̀lú wọn wá sí Jerúsálẹ́mù.
David looked to Jehovah as the real King of Israel, so he arranged for the Ark, which symbolized God’s presence, to be brought into the city.
jw2019
(Hébérù 13:15, 16) Ẹ̀wẹ̀, wọ́n ń sin Ọlọ́run nínú tẹ́ńpìlì tẹ̀mí, èyí tó jẹ́ “ilé àdúrà fún gbogbo àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè” gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ti tẹ́ńpìlì ní Jerúsálẹ́mù.
(Hebrews 13:15, 16) Moreover, they worship at God’s spiritual temple, which, like the temple at Jerusalem, is “a house of prayer for all the nations.”
jw2019

examples.yoruba: Davies parí ọ̀rọ̀ ní wíwí pé: “Ìdí náà gan-an tíHomosapiens fi gbọ́dọ̀ ní agbá ra lá ti mọ à wọn à nímọ́ à gbá álá ayé jẹ́ à dììtú jíjinlẹ̀ kan....
examples.english: Davies concludes by saying: “Just why Homosapiens should carry the spark of rationality that provides the key to the universe, is a deep enigma....

examples.yoruba: Meave Leakey tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lá ra à wọn tó kọ ìròyìn lórí ìwá dìí nípa à kẹ̀kù yìí wá sọ pé: “Wíwà tí wọ́n jọ wà nígbà kan náà yìí mú kó dà bí ohun tí kò ṣeé ṣe pé kí 'Homohabilis' para dà di 'Homoerectus.'

examples.english: He also says: “Language does indeed create a gulf between Homosapiens [humans] and the rest of the natural world.”

examples.yoruba: Àmọ́, níbi tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ jìn síra lórílẹ̀-èdè Kẹ́ń yà, à wọn onímọ̀ sá yẹ́ǹsì ti ṣà wárí à kẹ̀kù méjì kan. Wọ́n sì sọ pé à wọn à kẹ̀kù méjèèjì náà, ìyẹnHomohabilis à tiHomoerectus, tí wọ́n rò pé ẹ̀dá èèyàn tara wọn ṣẹ̀ wá, jọ wà nígbà kan náà ni.

examples.english: Says one medical dictionary: “LYCANTHROPY... from [lyʹkos], lupus, wolf; [anʹthro·pos], homo, man.

jw2019
Davies parí ọ̀rọ̀ ní wíwí pé: “Ìdí náà gan-an tí Homo sapiens fi gbọ́dọ̀ ní agbára láti mọ àwọn ànímọ́ àgbáálá ayé jẹ́ àdììtú jíjinlẹ̀ kan. . . .
Davies concludes by saying: “Just why Homo sapiens should carry the spark of rationality that provides the key to the universe, is a deep enigma. . . .
jw2019
Meave Leakey tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó kọ ìròyìn lórí ìwádìí nípa àkẹ̀kù yìí wá sọ pé: “Wíwà tí wọ́n jọ wà nígbà kan náà yìí mú kó dà bí ohun tí kò ṣeé ṣe pé kí ‘Homo habilis’ para dà di ‘Homo erectus.’
“Their co-existence makes it unlikely that Homo erectus evolved from Homo habilis,” states Meave Leakey, one of the authors of the report.
jw2019
Ó tún sọ pé: “Ní gidi, èdè mú kí ìyàtọ̀ wà láàárín Homo sapiens [ènìyàn] àti àwọn ẹ̀dá abẹ̀mí yòókù.”
He also says: “Language does indeed create a gulf between Homo sapiens [humans] and the rest of the natural world.”
jw2019
Àmọ́, níbi tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ jìn síra lórílẹ̀-èdè Kẹ́ńyà, àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ́ǹsì ti ṣàwárí àkẹ̀kù méjì kan. Wọ́n sì sọ pé àwọn àkẹ̀kù méjèèjì náà, ìyẹn Homo habilis àti Homo erectus, tí wọ́n rò pé ẹ̀dá èèyàn tara wọn ṣẹ̀ wá, jọ wà nígbà kan náà ni.
Two fossils found within walking distance of each other in Kenya, however, have now been interpreted as indicating that the two species Homo habilis and Homo erectus, thought to be human ancestors, lived at the same time.
jw2019
Ọjọgbọn Léon Homo sọ pe èrò awọn ará ilu tako awọn Kristian ijimiji nitori “itara aláwọ̀ṣe” wọn.
Professor Léon Homo relates that the early Christians had public opinion against them because of their “ardent proselytism.”
jw2019
Anselm, Olori biṣọọbu ti Canterbury, gbiyanju lati dahun awọn ibeere wọnyi ninu iwe rẹ Cur Deus Homo (Idi ti Ọlọrun Fi Di Eniyan).
Anselm, Archbishop of Canterbury, attempted to answer these questions in his book Cur Deus Homo (Why God Became Man).
jw2019
Homo sapiens [ní Látìn, ọlọgbọ́n ènìyàn], gẹ́gẹ́ bí ènìyàn ti ń pe ara rẹ̀ láìwà-níwọ̀ntún-wọ̀nsì, ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ ní agbára pátápátá, ó sì ti jáwọ́ kíká ara rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ kò lọ́nàkọnà.”
Homo sapiens [Latin, wise man], as man so immodestly calls himself, has almost absolute power and has ceased to exercise any restraint.”
jw2019
Ìwé atúmọ̀ èdè ìṣègùn kan sọ pé: “Àrùn LYCANTHROPY . . . láti inú [lyʹkos], lupus, ìkookò; [anʹthro·pos], homo, ènìyàn.
Says one medical dictionary: “LYCANTHROPY . . . from [lyʹkos], lupus, wolf; [anʹthro·pos], homo, man.
jw2019
Báwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ́ǹsì bá ń ṣàlàyé apá mẹ́ta tó kẹ́yìn nínú “béèyàn ṣe ti ara ẹranko jáde,” wọ́n á ní lẹ́yìn Homo habilis ó para dà di Homo erectus kó tó wá di “ẹ̀dá adáríhurun” ìyẹn, Homo sapiens.
Scientists often portray the final “stages” of “human evolution” as a progression from Homo habilis to Homo erectus to “modern man,” Homo sapiens.

Translations of "hàn" into English in sentences, translation memory

• Báwo la ṣe lè fi hàn pé à ń bọ̀wọ̀ fáwọn ará wa tó ti dàgbàlagbà?
• How can we show tender regard for aging fellow worshippers?
jw2019
Kò ṣòro rárá fún àwọn Kristian tí wọ́n ní ojúlówó ọkàn-ìfẹ́ nínú araawọn láti fi ìfẹ́ wọn hàn nígbàkigbà nínú ọdún.
Christians who have a genuine interest in one another find no difficulty in spontaneously expressing their love at any time of the year.
jw2019
(7) Wọ́n ń fi bí a ṣe lè kápá àwọn ìṣòro òde òní hàn.
(7) They show how to cope with today’s problems.
jw2019
Ni imurasilẹ fun kíkí pupọ sii awọn olùfìfẹ́hàn kaabọ si awọn ipade, bi o ti wu ki o ri, a fun wa niṣiiri lati pe araawa ẹnikinni keji pẹlu awọn orukọ idile.
In preparation for welcoming many more interested ones to our meetings, however, we were encouraged to refer to one another by family names.
jw2019
La bá pàgọ́ síbì kan tó tẹ́jú nínú oko olùfìfẹ́hàn kan.
So we put up a tent on an open piece of ground on the farm of an interested person.
jw2019
Ó dájú pé bó o ṣe fi hàn pé ọ̀ràn wọn jẹ ẹ́ lógún máa wú wọn lórí.
No doubt they’ll be pleased that you care enough to ask about their life.
jw2019
12 Orin Dáfídì 143:5 fi ohun tí Dáfídì ṣe hàn, nígbà tí ó dojú kọ ewu àti àdánwò ńláǹlà pé: “Èmí rántí ọjọ́ àtijọ́; èmí ṣe àṣàrò iṣẹ́ rẹ gbogbo, èmí ń ronú iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ rẹ.”
12 Psalm 143:5 indicates what David did when beset with danger and great trials: “I have remembered days of long ago; I have meditated on all your activity; I willingly kept myself concerned with the work of your own hands.”
jw2019
Tá a bá ń “gbàdúrà láìdabọ̀,” èyí á fi hàn pé ìgbàgbọ́ wa jinlẹ̀ lóòótọ́.—1 Tẹsalóníkà 5:17.
To “pray constantly” in this way shows we have genuine faith. —1 Thessalonians 5:17.
jw2019
(Fílípì 2:8) Jésù tún fi hàn pé èèyàn pípé lè jẹ́ olóòótọ́ délẹ̀délẹ̀ sí Jèhófà láìka àdánwò tó le jù lọ sí.
(Philippians 2:8) Jesus also proved that a perfect man could maintain perfect integrity to Jehovah despite the severest of trials.
jw2019
Fi hàn án pé Ọlọ́run kọ́ wa pé kí a ‘nífẹ̀ẹ́ aládùúgbò wa.’—Mát.
Show that God teaches “love your neighbor.” —Matt.
jw2019
12-14. (a) Báwo ni Jésù ṣe máa ń fìrẹ̀lẹ̀ hàn báwọn èèyàn bá yìn ín?
12-14. (a) How did Jesus show humility when people praised him?
jw2019
Bí Ìtàn Ìdílé Ṣe Fi Mèsáyà Hàn
Genealogy and Messiah’s Identification
jw2019
19 Awọn oju ti wọn yi awọn àgbá kẹ̀kẹ́-ẹṣin Ọlọrun ká fi iwalojufo hàn.
19 The eyes all around the wheels of God’s chariot indicate alertness.
jw2019
(Mátíù 4:1-4) Níwọ̀n bí ohun ìní rẹ̀ kò ti ju bíi mélòó kan lọ, ìyẹn fi hàn pé kò lo agbára rẹ̀ láti fi kó ọrọ̀ jọ.
(Matthew 4:1-4) His meager possessions were evidence that he did not profit materially from the use of his power.
jw2019
Báwo la ṣe lè fi hàn pé a fẹ́ràn Jèhófà?— Ohun àkọ́kọ́ ni pé kí á mọ Jèhófà dáadáa pé ó jẹ́ Ọ̀rẹ́ wa.
How can we show that we love Jehovah?— One way is by getting to know him as a Friend.
jw2019
Ohun Tí Àkọsílẹ̀ Fi Hàn
What the Statistics Reveal
jw2019
Síbẹ̀, nígbà tí a bá dúró gbọn-in fún ohun tó tọ́—bóyá nílé ẹ̀kọ́, níbi iṣẹ́ wa, tàbí lábẹ́ ipò èyíkéyìí mìíràn—Jèhófà kì í fojú yẹpẹrẹ wo ìdúróṣinṣin onífẹ̀ẹ́ tí a fi hàn.
Yet, when we stand firm for what is right —whether in school, at our place of employment, or in any other situation— Jehovah does not take our loyal love for granted.
jw2019
(Máàkù 12:28-31) Pọ́ọ̀lù gbà wá níyànjú láti rí i dájú pé ìfẹ́ tí à ń fi hàn gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni wá látọkàn wa.
(Mark 12:28-31) Paul exhorts us to make sure that the love we show as Christians is sincere.
jw2019
Jésù fi hàn pé gẹ́gẹ́ bí Bàbá òun ṣe nífẹ̀ẹ́ wa ni òun náà ṣe nífẹ̀ẹ́ wa.
Jesus proved that he had the same love for us that his Father had.
jw2019
Ó ṣe tán, torí pé a mọyì ìfẹ́ jíjinlẹ̀ tí Ọlọ́run àti Kristi fi hàn sí wa ló mú ká ya ìgbésí ayé wa sí mímọ́ fún Ọlọ́run tá a sì di ọmọ ẹ̀yìn Kristi.—Jòhánù 3:16; 1 Jòhánù 4:10, 11.
After all, gratitude for the depth of the love that God and Christ have shown us compelled us to dedicate our lives to God and become disciples of Christ. —John 3:16; 1 John 4:10, 11.
jw2019
Bóyá o tiẹ̀ ti ń sọ lọ́kàn rẹ pé, ‘Bó ṣe dà bíi pé Jèhófà ò ṣe nǹkan kan nípa àdánwò mi yìí, ǹjẹ́ èyí ò fi hàn pé kò mọ ohun tí mò ń dojú kọ tàbí pé kò tiẹ̀ bìkítà nípa mi?’
Perhaps you wonder, ‘Does the fact that Jehovah appears not to have done anything about my trial mean that he is unaware of my situation or that he does not care about me?’
jw2019
16 Fífìfẹ́ hàn sí àwọn ẹlòmíràn kò mọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tó ń gbé lágbègbè wa o.
16 Our showing love to others is not limited to those who may live in our vicinity.
jw2019
Àwọn ìwádìí fi hàn pé àwọn aláìsàn tètè máa ń gbádùn, wọn kì í sì fi bẹ́ẹ̀ níṣòro lẹ́yìn iṣẹ́ abẹ.
Studies show that the patients recover faster and with fewer problems after surgery.
jw2019
Lọ́nà tó tako ìmọ̀ ọgbọ́n orí Gíríìkì, Ìwé Mímọ́ fi hàn kedere pé ọkàn kì í ṣe ohun tí ènìyàn ní ṣùgbọ́n ohun tí ó jẹ́.
Contrary to Greek philosophy, the Scriptures clearly show that the soul is not what a person has but what he is.
jw2019
Níti gidi, èyí fi hàn lọ́nà tí ó lágbára pé Ìjọba Ọlọrun ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ síí ṣàkóso.
Actually, this is a strong indication that God’s Kingdom has begun ruling.
jw2019

examples.yoruba: * Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tá a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tún kọ́ ní 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, Hawaii Ní February 11 sí 15, 2020, ìyẹn kí à rùn COVID-19 tó gbayé kan, lẹ́yìn tá a ti tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba à kọ́kọ́ yẹn kọ́, à wọn ará wa pe à wọn ará ìlú, à wọn aṣojú ìjọba à tà wọn olùkọ́ lá ti wá ṣèbẹ̀wò kí wọ́n sì rín yí ká ilé náà.
examples.english: * The Kingdom Hall shortly after it was built in1935Before the COVID-19 pandemic, our brothers invited the local community, government officials, and educators to an open house from February 11 to 15, 2020, after completely remodeling the historic building.

examples.yoruba: Nigba ti a lọ siHonolulufun apejọpọ Kristian kan ni 1943, Donald Haslett ẹni ti ó jẹ́ alaboojuto ayika ni Hawaii nigba yẹn, késí wa lati wá sibẹ ki a sì maa gbé ninu ile kekere kan ti a kọ́ si òkè ibi ìgbọ́kọ̀sí Watch Tower Society.
examples.english: When we went to Honolulufor a Christian convention in 1943, Donald Haslett, who was then branch overseer in Hawaii, invited us to move there and live in a small apartment built over the Watch Tower Society's garage.

examples.yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ ìpèsè ìrà nlọ́wọ́ kan ní a gbékalẹ̀ lá ti díwọ̀n à ìní náà kí wọ́n sì gba à wọn ohun tí a nílò náà nípasẹ̀ ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì níHonolulu.
examples.english: A relief committee was set up to assess the needs and to obtain the needed materials through the branch office in Honolulu.

examples.yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìjùmọ̀sọ̀rọ̀pọ̀ à ti ètò ìrìnnà-ọkọ̀ ní a ṣèdíwọ́ fún dé ìwọ̀n-à yè tí ó ga, à wọn aṣojú ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society mẹ́ta níHonoluluwà lá ra à wọn tí ó kọ́kọ́ dé síbi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ìjì-líle náà, níwọ̀n bí à jọ tí ń dá àbòbo à wọn ará-ìlú ti fún wọn ní à kà nṣe ìyọọda lá ti wọ ọkọ̀-òfuurufú lọ sí Kauai.
examples.english: Even though communication and transportation were badly disrupted, three representatives of the Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society's branch office in Honoluluwere among the first to arrive on the scene following the hurricane, having been granted special permission by civil defense to fly to Kauai.

examples.yoruba: Níwọ̀n bí ó ti rọrùn lá ti gba ìwé à ṣẹ fún wíwọ erékùṣù wọ̀nyí, mà má mi wá ń gbé nítòsí wa nílùúHonolulu.
examples.english: Since it was easy to enter these islands, Mother came and lived near us in the city of Honolulu.

examples.yoruba: Ní Sunday tí ó tẹ̀lé e, gbogbo ìjọ mẹ́fẹ̀ẹ̀fà ṣe Ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Ilé-Ìṣọ́nà kan, wọ́n gbọ́ ọ̀rọ̀-à sọyé ọlọ́gbọ̀n ìṣẹ́jú lórí ọ̀nà ìgbà pèsè ìrà nlọ́wọ́ lá ti ẹnu mẹ́ḿ bà Ìgbìmọ̀ Ìpèsè Ìrà nlọ́wọ́ kan, à ti ọ̀rọ̀-à sọyé ìparí ọlọ́gbọ̀n ìṣẹ́jú lá ti ẹnu mẹ́ḿ bà Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka tí ó tiHonoluluwá sí ibẹ̀ fún ète yìí.
examples.english: The next Sunday, all six congregations had a Watchtower Study, a 30-minute talk on relief procedures by a member of the Relief Committee, and a concluding 30-minute talk by a member of the Branch Committee who had come over from Honolulufor this purpose.

examples.yoruba: Wọ́n yan à wọn ará kùnrin mélòó kan tó kúnjú ìwọ̀n lá ti ṣètò bí wọ́n á ṣe máa kọ́ à wọn ará tó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè náà à tà wọn tó wá lá ti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ní èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haiti.
examples.english: A team of qualified brothers was assigned to prepare a language course in Haitian Creole for foreign as well as local brothers and sisters.

examples.yoruba: Ní Saturday, Octo ber 6, 2018, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ kan tó lá gb ára wá yé ní agbègbè à ríwá ilẹ̀Haiti, ó pa èèyàn mẹ́tà dínlógún (17), ó sì ju ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (300) tó fara pa.
examples.english: On Saturday, October 6, 2018, a magnitude 5.9 earthquake struck the northern region of Haiti, killing 17 and injuring over 300.

examples.yoruba: Àmọ́, kí wọ́n lè túbọ̀ ran irú à wọn ẹni bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ lá ti ní à jọṣe tó dá ra pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run, lọ́dún 1993, Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ní kí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní erékùṣù Guadeloupe rán à wọn aṣá ájú-ọ̀nà à kà nṣe wá sí Orílẹ̀-èdè Dominican lá wọn ibi tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haiti.
examples.english: However, to provide better spiritual help for such ones, in 1993 the Governing Body directed the Guadeloupe branch to invite special pioneers from their territory to serve in the Haitian Creole field in the Dominican Republic.

examples.yoruba: Ará kùnrin Barnabé sọ pé: “Lẹ́yìn tá a bá à wọn ará kùnrin tó wá lá ti Ẹ̀ka Iṣẹ́ Ìsìn sọ̀rọ̀, ó jọ pé ó bọ́gbọ́n mu ká dá wọ́ iṣẹ́ dúró fún ìgbà díẹ̀ lá wọn ìpínlẹ̀ ìwà ásù tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haiti.”
examples.english: “We met with the brothers from the Service Department,” explains Barnabé, “and it seemed advisable to stop the work in theHaitianCreole field for the time being.”

examples.yoruba: Ó tó ọgbọ̀n [30] orílẹ̀-èdè tá wọn tó wá sìn níbi tá a ti nílò oníwà ásù púpọ̀ sí i ti wá, wọ́n sì dara pọ̀ mọ́ à wọn ìjọ tó ń lo Èdè Àwọn Adití Lọ́nà ti Amẹ́ríkà, Chinese, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haiti, Italian, Russian à ti Sípá níìṣì.
examples.english: “Need greaters” from as many as 30 different nationalities have become integrated into American Sign Language (ASL), Chinese, English, Haitian Creole, Italian, Russian, and Spanish congregations.

examples.yoruba: Haiti: Gérole à ti ọmọ rẹ̀ obìnrin ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì
examples.english: Haiti: Gérole and her daughter have many Bible studies

examples.yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ à wọn ará ilẹ̀Haitiló fẹ́ràn à wọn ohun tó ní à wọ̀ mèremère.
examples.english: Most Haitianslove color.

examples.yoruba: Ní oṣù January ọdún 1996, akéde mẹ́sàn-án nílùú Higüey à tà wọn akéde mẹ́wàá míì nílùú Santo Domingo múra tán lá ti lọ ran à wùjọ tó ń sọ èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haitilọ́wọ́.
examples.english: In January 1996, there were nine publishers in Higüey and ten publishers in Santo Domingo who were willing to support a Haitian Creole group.

examples.yoruba: Kí n tó kúrò níHaiti, méjì lá ra à wọn tó ń gba ìtọ́jú tí wọ́n ti gé apá ọ̀tún wọn gbìyà njú lá ti kọ lẹ́tà “o ṣeun,” wọ́n sì tẹnu mọ́ ọn fún mi pé, tí n bá ti wà nínú ọkọ̀ òfuurufú ni kí n tó kà wọ́n.
examples.english: Before I left Haiti, two of the patients who had had their right arms amputated managed to write me thank-you letters that they insisted I read only after I got on the plane.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà míì, ọkọ̀ tí wọ́n bá fi kó ẹrù tí wọ́n fi ṣèrà nwọ́ wá síHaitiló máa ń yá ra kó à wọn tó fara pa yìí lọ sá wọn ilé ìwòsàn ká àki ri Orílẹ̀-èdè Dominican.
examples.english: At times, the very vehicles that had taken relief supplies to Haitirushed the injured to various medical centers throughout the Dominican Republic.

examples.yoruba: Ọjọ́ má nigbàgbé ni Tuesday, January 12, ọdún 2010 jẹ́ fá wọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Dominican à tiHaiti.
examples.english: Tuesday, January 12, 2010, will long be imprinted on the minds of Dominicans and Haitians.

examples.yoruba: Lọ́jọ́ kejì, wọ́n fi ọkọ̀ gbé wa lọ sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsìHaititó wà ní ìlú Port-au-Prince, ó jẹ́ ìrìn à jò wá kàtí méje à tà àbọ̀.
examples.english: The next morning, we were driven to the Haitibranch office in Port-au-Prince, a journey of seven and a half hours.

examples.yoruba: Wíwà ásù Lédè Creole TiHaiti
examples.english: The Haitian Creole Field

examples.yoruba: Téèyàn bá lọ sí à ríwá tà bí gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdèHaiti, èèyàn á rí i pé orílẹ̀-èdè náà lẹ́wà gan-an.
examples.english: Were you to travel north or south, you would find Haitito be picturesque.

examples.yoruba: Mo lo ohun tó lé díẹ̀ ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì níHaitilá ti ṣèrà nwọ́ fún à wọn tí à já lù bá.
examples.english: Altogether I spent a little over two weeks in the Haitianrelief work.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí ará bìnrin yìí wà lóde ẹ̀rí, ó pà dé tọkọtaya kan tó ń sọ èdèHaiti, tí wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.
examples.english: While in the ministry, this sister found an interested Haitiancouple.

examples.yoruba: Fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún, à wọn ìjọ tó ń sọ èdè Sípá níìṣì ni wọ́n máa ń ní kí à wọn ọmọ ilẹ̀Haititó ń sọ èdè Creole dara pọ̀ mọ́ kí wọ́n lè rí ìrà nlọ́wọ́ tẹ̀mí gbà.
examples.english: For years, Haitian Creole-speaking individuals who showed interest in the truth were directed to Spanish congregations for spiritual assistance.

examples.yoruba: Ní bá yìí, bí akéde kan tó jẹ́ ọmọ Orílẹ̀-èdè Dominican bá ń fi èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haitiṣà làyé ẹ̀kọ́ òtítọ́, ara à wọn tó ń bá sọ̀rọ̀ máa ń balẹ̀, wọ́n á sì túbọ̀ tẹ́tí sí ìhìn rere Ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
examples.english: Now, when a Dominican publisher explains Bible truths in Haitian Creole, it dissipates tension and creates a favorable atmosphere for sharing the Kingdom message.

examples.yoruba: Ní à wọn ọdún tó tẹ̀ lé e, wọ́n tún rán à wọn míṣọ́nná rì míì pé kí wọ́n lọ ṣiṣẹ́ lá wọn ibi tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haitiní Orílẹ̀-èdè Dominican.
examples.english: In subsequent years, several more missionaries were assigned to the Dominican Republic to work in the Haitian Creole field.

examples.yoruba: Ìbẹ́mìílò wọ́pọ̀ gan-an ní orílẹ̀-èdèHaiti.
examples.english: Spiritism is quite prevalent in Haiti.

examples.yoruba: “Apá ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọ̀rúndún kẹtà dínlógún ni wọ́n tẹ ìlú tó parọ́rọ́ yìí dó. Nígbà yẹn, à wọn sójà ará Poland kan wá sílẹ̀Haitilá ti wá ran à wọn tó jẹ́ ẹrú nígbà kan rí lọ́wọ́ lá ti jà fún òmìnira.
examples.english: “The history of this quiet town goes back to the early 1800's when some Polish soldiers who came to Haitito help former slaves win independence settled in this fertile valley with their Haitian wives.

examples.yoruba: ● Wọ́n yọ Winnie ọmọ ọdún kan à to ṣù mẹ́rin lá bẹ́ à wókù ilé ní orílẹ̀-èdèHaiti.
examples.english: ● Winnie, 16 months old, is pulled from the rubble in Haiti.

examples.yoruba: Erékùṣù kan térò pọ̀ sí ni orílẹ̀-èdèHaiti, wọ́n sì ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ gé gbogbo igi tó wà níbẹ̀ tán.
examples.english: Haitiis an island nation with a high population and a history of deforestation.

examples.yoruba: Wọ́n dá à yíká míì tó ń sọ èdè Creole ti ilẹ̀Haitisílẹ̀ ní September 1, ọdún 2009, to rí wọ́n ti ní ìjọ mẹ́tà lélógún [23] à ti ogún [20] à wùjọ.
examples.english: By September 1, 2009, there were 23Haitian Creole congregations and 20 groups, so a second circuit was formed.

examples.yoruba: Ìmìtìtì Ilẹ̀ Tó Runlérùnnà Wá yé Lórílẹ̀-ÈdèHaiti149
examples.english: Earthquake in Haiti149

examples.english: The International Helsinki Federation “has charged 19 European countries with violating religious freedoms,” reports the magazine Catholic International.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí ó fi di ọdún 1975, Ogun Tútù náà ti dẹwọ́ tó fún à wọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè 35, tí ó ní United States à ti Rọ́ṣíà nínú, lá ti fọwọ́ sí ohun tí a wá mọ̀ sí ÀdéhùnHelsinki.

▪ Egbòogi: Bí ẹnì kan tí ń ṣe bá ní ìṣòro rírí oorun sùn tàbí tó bá ń jìyà hílàhílo, pákáǹleke, tàbí ìsoríkọ́, dókítà kan lè kọ egbòogi akunnilóorun tàbí apẹ̀rọ̀ ìdààmú ọkàn láti mú àwọn àmì àrùn wọ̀nyí dẹ̀rọ̀ fún un.
▪ Medication: If a sufferer has difficulty sleeping or suffers anxiety, tension, or depression, a doctor may prescribe sedatives or antidepressants to ease these symptoms.
jw2019
(Sáàmù 34:18) Ohun mìíràn tó tún lè ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti kojú hílàhílo tó bá wọn ni kí wọ́n gbà pé àwọn onígbàgbọ́ ẹlẹgbẹ́ wọn tó wà nínú ìjọ Kristẹni lóye wọn, wọn ò sì ní padà lẹ́yìn àwọn.
(Psalm 34:18) Further help to cope with their trauma can come from accepting the sincere understanding and gentle support of fellow believers in the Christian congregation.
jw2019
Ọkàn mi kún fún ọpẹ́ sí Ọlọ́run kan tí ó mọ ẹ̀rù, ìrora, àti hílàhílo tí ó wà nínú wa lọ́hùn-ún.
My heart overflows with appreciation for a God who knows our most intimate fears, pains, and traumas.
jw2019
Tàbí kẹ̀, ǹjẹ́ o rántí bí gbogbo nǹkan ṣe ń tojú súni láwọn ọdún hílàhílo wọ̀nyẹn, nígbà tó o ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí bàlágà?
Or do you remember how you were during those sometimes turbulent adolescent years?
jw2019
Bóyá o lè mú un lọ wo Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà nígbà tí kò bá sí ìpàdé tí ń lọ lọ́wọ́, kí o baà lè dín hílàhílo èyíkéyìí tí òún lè ní nípa lílọ sí ibi tuntun fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ kù.
Perhaps you could take him to see the Kingdom Hall when a meeting is not in progress so as to alleviate any anxiety he may have about going to a new place for the first time.
jw2019
Àmọ́, nígbà táwọn èèyàn Ọlọ́run bá wà “nínú hílàhílo,” wọn yóò wá Jèhófà.—Hóséà 4:1-5:15.
When God’s people were “in sore straits,” however, they would seek Jehovah. —Hosea 4:1–5:15.
jw2019
Ìgbà yẹn ni mo wá rí i pé mo ní láti mọ ohun tí mo nílò nípa tẹ̀mí kí n sì wá nǹkan ṣe nípa rẹ̀ tí mo bá fẹ́ ní ìtẹ́lọ́rùn àti ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn, níwọ̀n bí hílàhílo ayé àti bíbójútó ohun tó ń da àwọn ẹlòmíràn láàmú ti lè kó jìnnìjìnnì bá ẹni tó bá ń ṣe irú iṣẹ́ tí mò ń ṣe yìí.
I then realized that I had to acknowledge and satisfy my spiritual need if I was to gain contentment and tranquillity, since the pace of life and the demand of caring for people’s concerns can become overwhelming for someone in my profession.
jw2019
Kí ló ran Énọ́kù lọ́wọ́ tó fi lè bá Ọlọ́run rìn nígbà hílàhílo?
How was Enoch able to walk with God despite living in turbulent times?
jw2019
Ìbẹ̀rù ebi, àrùn, ìwà ọ̀daràn, tàbí ogun ti kó ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye ènìyàn sínú hílàhílo ìgbà gbogbo.
Fear of hunger, disease, crime, or war keeps millions of people in constant anxiety.
jw2019
8 Àmọ́ ṣá o, báwo lèèyàn ṣe lè gbé ìgbésí ayé lọ́nà tó yẹ kí Kristẹni máa gbé e lákòókò hílàhílo yìí, tí ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ èèyàn ò fẹ́ sin Jèhófà?
8 How, though, is it possible to live as Christians should when times are so turbulent and most people have no interest in serving Jehovah?
jw2019
Ẹ ò rí i pé àǹfààní ńlá ló jẹ́ láti mọ àwọn ará tó di ìwà títọ́ wọn mú ní àkókò hílàhílo yẹn!
What a privilege it was to get to know brothers and sisters whose integrity had stood the test of time!
jw2019
Ìsoríkọ́ àti hílàhílo ṣíṣàjèjì sábà máa ń ṣe àwọn tí àìsàn FMS ń ṣe, ó sì jọ pé kì í ṣe ìyọrísí àwọn ìṣòro wọ̀nyí, àmọ́ àìsàn FMS ló sábà máa ń fa àwọn ìṣòro náà.
Depression and abnormal anxiety are common among FMS sufferers, and it appears that FMS is generally the cause of these problems and not the result.
jw2019
Awọn diẹ, ó kerepin, ninu iran-eniyan naa.tí wọn rí “ibeṛẹ irora hílàhílo” ní 1914 yoo walaaye lati rí imupadabọsipo Paradise lori ilẹ-aye.
Some, at least, of the generation that saw the “beginning of pangs of distress” in 1914 will live to see Paradise restored on earth.
jw2019
“Àwọn ọkùnrin Ísírẹ́lì fúnra wọn . . . rí i pé wọ́n wà nínú hílàhílo, nítorí pé a ni àwọn ènìyàn náà lára dé góńgó; àwọn ènìyàn náà sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí fi ara wọn pa mọ́ sínú àwọn hòrò àti sínú àwọn ibi jíjinkòtò àti àwọn àpáta gàǹgà àti ihò abẹ́lẹ̀ àti àwọn kòtò omi.”
“The men of Israel themselves saw that they were in sore straits, because the people were hard pressed; and the people went hiding themselves in the caves and the hollows and the crags and the vaults and the waterpits.”
jw2019
Ọ̀nà yòówù táwọn àdánwò lè gbà wá, wọ́n máa ń kóni sínú hílàhílo tó lé kenkà.
Whatever form trials take, they often cause great anxiety.
jw2019
Nítorí ogun, nǹkan bíi mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá ọmọdé ni a ti kó hílàhílo bá.
Because of war, some ten million children are psychologically traumatized.
jw2019
Wọ́n lè máà lóye gbogbo hílàhílo táwọn ọ̀dọ́ ń kojú rẹ̀ láyé òde òní; ṣùgbọ́n ṣé o kò rò pé wọ́n lè mọ̀ ọ́ dáadáa ju bí ẹlòmíràn ṣe lè mọ̀ ọ́ láyé yìí lọ?
They may not fully understand all the pressures young ones face in today’s world; however, isn’t it true that they probably know you better than anyone else in the world does?
jw2019
15 Dídi ìgbàgbọ́ mú lójú hílàhílo: Ìgbàgbọ́ pẹ̀lú jẹ́ apá pàtàkì nínú ìgbésí ayé wa.
15 Maintaining faith in the face of adversity: Faith too is a vital aspect of our lives.
jw2019
Tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà bá fa hílàhílo, àwọn mìíràn lè pinnu láti lọ gbàtọ́jú lọ́dọ̀ oníṣègùn kan tàbí olùtọ́jú ọpọlọ tó níwèé àṣẹ ìjọba.
In cases of trauma, some may choose to be treated by a physician or a licensed mental-health worker.
jw2019
(Jòhánù 17:16; Róòmù 8:2; Kólósè 1:13; Ìṣípayá 18:2, 4) Paríparí rẹ̀, ní ti àwọn olóòótọ́ ìránṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run, ìgbàlà látọ̀dọ̀ Ọlọ́run kò mọ sórí ìdáǹdè kúrò lọ́wọ́ ìfojú-ẹni-gbolẹ̀ àti hílàhílo nìkan, ó tún nasẹ̀ dórí àǹfààní níní ìyè àìnípẹ̀kun.
(John 17:16; Romans 8:2; Colossians 1:13; Revelation 18:2, 4) Ultimately, for God’s faithful servants, salvation by God means not only deliverance from oppression and distress but also the opportunity to have everlasting life.
jw2019
Ó ṣàǹfààní gidigidi láti finú han ọ̀rẹ́ tí a gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé nípa hílàhílo.
There is great value in confiding anxieties to a trusted friend.
jw2019
Ìwé ìròyìn FDA Consumer náà sọ pé: “Ìjóni kan tí ó pọ̀ gan-an jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn hílàhílo ẹlẹ́rùjẹ̀jẹ̀ jù lọ tí ó lè jẹ ara níyà.”
“A serious burn is one of the most horrendous traumas the body can suffer,” says the FDA Consumer.
jw2019
Nígbà kan, Ọba Dafidi ti Israeli nímọ̀lára pé hílàhílo náà kò fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ ṣeé fara dà mọ́.
At one time King David of Israel felt that the pressure was almost unbearable.
jw2019
Nígbà mìíràn, lílo egbòogi máa ń fa inú ríro nítorí ebi, tàbí kí oúnjẹ jíjẹ di ọ̀nà tí ẹnì kan ń gbà bá hílàhílo jà.
Sometimes medications bring on hunger pains, or eating becomes a way of dealing with anxiety.
jw2019

For a discussion of archaeological evidence supporting the Bible’s account, see The Watchtower, July 1, 1989, pages 4-7.

Ancient contracts unearthed at Nuzi, Larsa, and other sites in modern Iraq illustrate such agreements.
jw2019

Inscriptions found at archaeological sites seem to support this view.

Unearthed remains of these cities confirm that the Bible refers to real places.

This is evidenced by the many figurines that have been unearthed, with exaggerated sexual features, depicting sexual arousal.
jw2019
Kí ní ń tìdí gbígbàgbọ́ pé inú ẹranko ni a ti hú yọ jáde?
What are the consequences of believing that we evolved from animals?

Cuneiform scholars worldwide have the massive task of translation.

examples.english: 71 To the Gerʹshom·ites they assigned from the family of the half tribe of Ma·nasʹseh, Goʹlan+ in Baʹshan with its pastures and Ashʹta·roth with its pastures;+ 72 and from the tribe of Isʹsa·char, Keʹdesh with its pastures, Dabʹe·rath+ with its pastures,+ 73 Raʹmoth with its pastures, and Aʹnem with its pastures; 74 and from the tribe of Ashʹer, Maʹshal with its pastures, Abʹdon with its pastures,+ 75 Huʹkok with its pastures, and Reʹhob+ with its pastures; 76 and from the tribe of Naphʹta·li, Keʹdesh+ in Galʹi·lee+ with its pastures, Hamʹmon with its pastures, and Kir·i·a·thaʹim with its pastures.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí ó bá ń bínú, ó le máa kùn ketekete bí ẹni ń húkọ́.
examples.english: When angry it may emit a loudcoughinghiss.

examples.yoruba: (4) Bí o bá fẹ́ ha ọ̀nà ọ̀fun, tà bí o fẹ́ húkọ́, tà bí o fẹ́ sín, rí i dá jú pé o gbẹ́nu kúrò níwá jú maki rofóònù.
examples.english: (4) If you need to clear your throat or have the urge tocoughor sneeze, be sure to turn your head away from the microphone.

examples.yoruba: Tá a bá sín, tá a bá fọwọ́ bo ẹnu wa nígbà táa húkọ́ tà bí tá a fọn imú.
examples.english: After sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose.
