examples.yoruba: Ó tún fi kún un pé: “Ní ìpínlẹ̀Hawaii, à wọn arìnrìn-à jò afẹ́ ló ń lo ìdá méjì nínú má rùn-ún ohun à múṣagbá ra, bóyá ní tà àràtà tà bí lá ìṣe tà àràtà, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì rèé, ìdá mẹ́jọ à wọn ará ìpínlẹ̀ yìí ló ń rìnrìn-à jò afẹ́.”
examples.english: He adds: “Directly and indirectly, tourism accounts for 40 percent of total energy consumed in Hawaii, although on average only one out of every eight people in Hawaiiis a tourist.”

examples.yoruba: Díẹ̀ lá ra oríṣiríṣi iyọ̀ tó wà (apá ọ̀tún sá pá òsì lá tòkè): (1) Iyọ̀ “Alaea” tí wọ́n ń rí nínú omi òkun, Hawaii; (2) iyọ̀ “fleur de sel,” ilẹ̀ Faransé; (3) iyọ̀ à bá láyé tí wọ́n ń rí nínú òkun; (4) iyọ̀ “sel gris” (iyọ̀ alá wọ̀ eérú), ilẹ̀ Faransé; (5) iyọ̀ wuuru tí wọ́n ń rí nínú òkun; (6) iyọ̀ dúdú tí wọ́n ń rí nínú ilẹ̀, Íń díà
examples.english: Some of the many varieties of salt (clockwise from top): (1) 'Alaea sea salt, Hawaii; (2) fleur de sel, France; (3) organic raw sea salt; (4) sel gris (gray salt), France; (5) coarse sea salt; (6) ground black salt, India

examples.yoruba: Àwọn ìtàn tí a gbọ́ lẹ́nu à wọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀Hawaii, à wọn míṣọ́nná rì, à wọn onímọ̀ sá yẹ́ǹsì à ti à wọn mìíràn fi hàn pé Mauna Loa ti tú nǹkan já de nígbà 48 lá ti 1832 wá, Kilauea sì ti tú nǹkan já de ju ìgbà 70 lọ lá ti 1790 wá.
examples.english: Historical accounts from native Hawaiians, missionaries, scientists, and others indicate that 48 eruptions have taken place on Mauna Loa since 1832 and more than 70 eruptions on Kilauea since 1790.

examples.yoruba: Òkè Ńlá Kilauea, Hawaii, ti fi nǹkan bí 200 ẹ́kí tà kún erékùṣù náà
examples.english: Mount Kilauea, Hawaii, has added about 500 acres [200 ha] to the island

examples.yoruba: Ará kùnrin Ricky ń gbé ní ìpínlẹ̀Hawaii, iṣẹ́ à wọn tó máa ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé ló ń ṣe. Wọ́n pè é kó máa tilé wá sìn ní Bẹ́tẹ́lì kó lè ṣèrà nwọ́ nídìí iṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ ní ìlú Warwick.
examples.english: Ricky, a construction project manager in Hawaii, was invited to serve as a commuter Bethelite to assist with the Warwick project.

examples.yoruba: Síbẹ̀, ìbúgbàù wọ̀nyí lè wà pẹ́ títí—òkè ayọná yèéfín Kilauea ní erékùṣùHawaiiti ń bú gbàù léraléra lá ti January 1983.
examples.english: Yet, these eruptions may be long-lived—Kilauea volcano on the island of Hawaiihas been erupting continually since January 1983.

examples.yoruba: Ní bá yìí, à wọn ìjọ mẹ́rin ló ń ṣèpà dé nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba yẹn, èdè má rùn-ún ni wọ́n sì fi ń ṣèpà dé níbẹ̀, títí kan èdèHawaiiPidgin.
examples.english: Today, 85 years later, the Pensacola Street Kingdom Hall is used by four congregations that support meetings held in five languages, including Hawaii Pidgin.

examples.yoruba: Ẹ̀ka iléeṣẹ́ tó wà ní Guam fi à wọn nǹkan tá a máa fi tún à wọn ilé tó bà jẹ́ ṣe rá nṣẹ́ títí kan à wọn òṣìṣẹ́, ẹ̀ka iléeṣẹ́ tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdèHawaiiṣèrà nwọ́ pẹ̀lú.
examples.english: The Guam branch supplied materials and manpower to repair damaged homes, and the Hawaiibranch gave support.

examples.yoruba: Lẹhin ilẹ olooru tiHawaii, iyipada ń láǹlà ni ó jẹ́!
examples.english: After tropical Hawaiiit was quite a change!

examples.yoruba: * Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tá a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tún kọ́ ní 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, HawaiiNí February 11 sí 15, 2020, ìyẹn kí à rùn COVID-19 tó gbayé kan, lẹ́yìn tá a ti tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba à kọ́kọ́ yẹn kọ́, à wọn ará wa pe à wọn ará ìlú, à wọn aṣojú ìjọba à tà wọn olùkọ́ lá ti wá ṣèbẹ̀wò kí wọ́n sì rín yí ká ilé náà.
examples.english: * The Kingdom Hall shortly after it was built in 1935 Before the COVID-19 pandemic, our brothers invited the local community, government officials, and educators to an open house from February 11 to 15, 2020, after completely remodeling the historic building.

examples.yoruba: Àmọ́, nígbà tó di ọdún 1935, Ará kùnrin Rutherford ṣe ìbẹ̀wò sí erékùṣùHawaii, níbi tí wọ́n ti ń kọ́ gbọ̀ngàn kan pa pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tuntun kan.
examples.english: In 1935, though, Brother Rutherford visited Hawaii, where a hall was being constructed in conjunction with a new branch office.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn onímọ̀ nípa òkè ayọná yèéfín ń lo ọ̀rọ̀ èdèHawaii“pahoehoe” fún à wọn ìṣàn olómi tí ń dán, tó rí kọ́lọkọ̀lọ, tó sì dà bí okùn, wọ́n wá ń pe ìṣàn à pá ta yíyòrò tí kò dán, tó rí pá gunpàgun, tó dà bí à fọ́kù à pá ta ní “aa”.
examples.english: Volcanologists use the Hawaiianterms “pahoehoe” for fluid flows having smooth, billowy, and ropy surfaces and “aa” for lava that is rough, jagged, and rubbly.

examples.yoruba: Àkọsílẹ̀ ìtàn lá ti 200 ọdún sẹ́yìn fi hàn pé à wọn erékùṣù méjèèjì tó wà níhà ìlà oòrùn gúúsù jù lọ, Hawaiià ti Maui, nìkan ló ti ń bú.
examples.english: Recorded history over the past 200 years indicates that only the two southeasternmost islands, Hawaiiand Maui, have been active.

examples.yoruba: 11 NiHawaiipẹ̀lú, a ti sapá lá ti tọ à wọn tí a kò lè bá nílé lọ.
examples.english: 11 In Hawaiitoo efforts have been made to reach those who cannot be found at home.

examples.yoruba: Níto rí pé ìṣàn à pá ta yíyòrò wọn máa ń jẹ́ olómi, ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ ìtújá de níHawaiikò bú rá rá, tà bí kí wọ́n ti rọra bú pà ápàá.
examples.english: Because of their typically fluid lava, most Hawaiianeruptions have been nonexplosive or only mildly explosive.

examples.yoruba: Ọ̀rọ̀ yẹn sá bà maa ń wá sọkan nigba ti awọn eniyan ba ronu nipaHawaii—ati fun awọn idi rere.
examples.english: That word often comes to mind when people think of Hawaii—and for good reasons.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn erékùṣùHawaiiń múni finú wòye ibi alá là áfíà kan ní ilẹ̀ olóoru, à wọn etíkun tí oòrùn ti ń mú, à ti ẹ̀fúùfù atura tí ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ máà dá wọ́ dúró.
examples.english: The Hawaiian Islands evoke visions of tropical paradise, sunny beaches, and balmy trade winds.

examples.yoruba: Bí o bá ń gbéHawaii, ilé rẹ ti sún ní nǹkan bí sẹ̀ǹtímítà 7.5 síhà ìwọ̀ oòrùn à ríwá lá ti èṣí!
examples.english: If you live in Hawaii, your home has crept about three inches [7.5 cm] to the northwest since last year!

examples.yoruba: Ní September 1992, Ìjì-Líle Iniki fẹ́lu erékùṣù Kauai tiHawaii, tí iye à wọn olùgbé ibẹ̀ jẹ́ 55,000.
examples.english: In September 1992, Hurricane Iniki hit the Hawaiianisland of Kauai, population 55,000.

examples.yoruba: ErékùṣùHawaii, tí a tún ń pè ní Erékùṣù Ńlá, fẹ̀ ju 10,000 kìlómítà lọ níbùú lóròó, nígbà tí Kahoolawe kékeré fẹ̀ tó kìlómítà 117 péré níbùú lóròó.
examples.english: The island of Hawaii, also called the Big Island, spans more than 4,000 square miles [10,000 sq km], whereas little Kahoolawe covers just 45 square miles [117 sq km].

examples.yoruba: Nigba ti a lọ si Honolulu fun apejọpọ Kristian kan ni 1943, Donald Haslett ẹni ti ó jẹ́ alaboojuto ayika niHawaiinigba yẹn, késí wa lati wá sibẹ ki a sì maa gbé ninu ile kekere kan ti a kọ́ si òkè ibi ìgbọ́kọ̀sí Watch Tower Society.
examples.english: When we went to Honolulu for a Christian convention in 1943, Donald Haslett, who was then branch overseer in Hawaii, invited us to move there and live in a small apartment built over the Watch Tower Society's garage.

examples.yoruba: Ará kùnrin Barry kú ní July 2, 1999, níbi tó ti ń bá à wùjọ sọ̀rọ̀ ní à péjọpọ̀ à gbègbè níHawaii.
examples.english: Brother Barry died on July 2, 1999, while having a direct part in serving a district convention in Hawaii.

examples.yoruba: Lá àárín ọ̀sẹ̀ bíi mélòó kan lẹ́yìn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wá yé, à wọn ká fíń tà wá lá tiHawaiilá ti wá bá wọn tún à wọn ilé tó bà jẹ́ kọ́, lá ra à wọn ará kùnrin tó wà ní Guam sì lo à kókò ìsinmi tí wọ́n ní lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ lá ti bá à wọn ará tó wá lá tiHawaiikọ́wọ́ ti iṣẹ́ náà.
examples.english: Within weeks, a team of carpenters arrived from Hawaiito help with the reconstruction work, and to assist them, some local brothers took vacation from their jobs.

examples.yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ à wọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò síbẹ̀ ló mọ à wọn mẹ́ta tó tó bi jù dunjú—Mauna Kea, tí a gbà pé kò lè bú gbàù, tí ó sì jẹ́ òkè tó ga jù níHawaii, tó fi 4,205 mítà ga kọjá ìtẹ́jú òkun; Mauna Loa, tí gíga rẹ̀ jẹ́ 4,169 mítà, tó sì jẹ́ òkè ayọná yèéfín tó tó bi jù níHawaii; à ti Kilauea, tí kò lọ́jọ́ lórí tó à wọn tó kù rá rá, tí ó sì wà ní bèbè ìhà gúúsù erékùṣù náà.
examples.english: Most visitors are familiar with the three largest—Mauna Kea, which is considered to be dormant and boasts the highest point in Hawaii, 13,796 feet [4,205 m] above sea level; Mauna Loa, which is 13,678 feet [4,169 m] and is the largest Hawaiian volcano in volume; and Kilauea, which is the youngest volcano and is located on the southern flank of the island.

examples.yoruba: Nipasẹ aibiki ta eniyan ati imọtara-ẹni-nikan, awọn erekuṣuHawaiini a ń fi diẹdiẹ jà lólè awọn ẹwà adanida wọn.
examples.english: Through human negligence and selfishness, the islands of Hawaiiare gradually being robbed of their natural beauty.

examples.yoruba: ”—Carol, lá ti erékùṣù Hawaii.
examples.english: You worry that they'll think you're odd.

examples.english: hawaii

Ó dà bí ẹni pé fídíò, tẹlifíṣọ̀n àti àwọn eré orí kọ̀m̀pútà ti ń gba ẹrú iṣẹ́ àwọn òbí ṣe nínú ọ̀pọ̀ ìdílé.
It seems that videos, TV, and computer games are taking over the role of the parents in many families.
jw2019
Àwọn jíjẹ-oyè-àlùfáà mĩràn tẹ̀lé e nínú èyítí àwọn kọ́kọ́rọ́ oyè àlùfáà ti di fífúnni láti ọwọ́ Mósè, Èlíjà, Élíásì, àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn wòlíì ìgbàanì (wo Ẹ&M 110; 128:18, 21).
Other ordinations followed in which priesthood keys were conferred by Moses, Elijah, Elias, and many ancient prophets (see D&C 110; 128:18, 21).
LDS
Mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà fún oúnjẹ tẹ̀mí tó ń bọ́ sákòókò yìí.”—M.T., láti orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.
I thank Jehovah for this spiritual food at the proper time.” —M.T., United States.
jw2019
Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìtumọ̀ yẹn, tẹlifíṣọ̀n aláwọ̀ oríṣiríṣi, tẹlifóònù alágbéérìn, tàbí kọ̀m̀pútà kékeré ni a óò ti kà sí iṣẹ́ ìyanu ní kìkì ọ̀rúndún kan sẹ́yìn!
By that definition, a color TV, a cellular phone, or a laptop computer would have been considered miracles just a century ago!
jw2019

examples.yoruba: Manu kan ọkọ̀ kan, eyi ti ẹja naa fà titi ti ó fi kanlẹ lori oke kan ninu awọn okeHimalaya.
examples.english: Manu builds a boat, which the fish pulls until it is grounded on a mountain in the Himalayas.

examples.yoruba: Orí à wọn òkèHimalayanìkan ni ẹranko panda pupa tó dà bí ológbò ń gbé (kódà a lè rí i ní gẹ̀rẹ́gẹ̀rẹ́ Òkè Everest, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lá ra à wọn òkèHimalaya).
examples.english: The red panda lives exclusively in the Himalayanmountain chain (even on the lower slopes of Mount Everest).

examples.yoruba: • Ìlú ń lá Pokhara rírẹwà, níbi tí Òkè ŃláHimalayatí yìnyín bò pitimu ti ń fúnni ní ìran à gbà yanu, ni Lil Kumari ń gbé.
examples.english: • Lil Kumari lives in the beautiful city of Pokhara, with a magnificent view of the snowcapped Himalaya Mountains.

examples.yoruba: Ewéko kékeré olóòórùn dídùn kan (ìyẹn Nardostachys jatamansi), tí wọ́n sá bà máa ń rí lórí ÒkèHimalaya, ni wọ́n fi ń ṣe ná ádì yìí tà bí sípíkéná dì tí wọ́n dá rúkọ nínú Bíbélì.
examples.english: The source of the nard, or spikenard, mentioned in the Bible is generally considered to be a small aromatic plant (Nardostachys jatamansi) found in the Himalaya Mountains.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn igbó kéékèèké tí ó ní igi quinua, igi lílá gb ára kan tí ó ga bí à wọn igi ahóyaya tiHimalaya, wà nínú à wọn ihò tí a dá ábò bò nínú ẹgàn paramo tí ó jẹ́ ahoro.
examples.english: In sheltered hollows of the desolate paramo are dwarf forests of quinua, a hardy tree that shares the altitude record with Himalayanpines.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn kan gbà gbọ́ pé Asia ni a ti lè rí i, ní Mesopotamia, tà bí lórí à wọn òkèHimalaya.
examples.english: Some believed that it was to be found in Asia, in Mesopotamia, or in the Himalayas.

examples.yoruba: James Scott, tí a mẹ́nu kàn níṣà ájú, ni a yọ, nígbẹ̀yìngbẹ́yín, nínú ewu ohun tí ì bá ti jẹ́ sà réè rẹ̀ níHimalaya.
examples.english: James Scott, mentioned earlier, was eventually rescued from what could have become his Himalayangrave.

examples.yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ adá gún omi oníyìnyín tó wà lórí à wọn òkèHimalayaló ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ ya bo bèbè wọn bá yìí, èyí ló sì ń fa omíyalé tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ léraléra lẹ́nu bí ọgbọ̀n sí ogójì ọdún bá yìí.
examples.english: Dozens of glacial lakes in the Himalayasnow threaten to burst their natural barriers and cause catastrophic floods, a phenomenon that has already occurred repeatedly in the last few decades.

examples.yoruba: Níto rí ìsìn ni à rà ádọ́ta ọ̀kẹ́ ká àki ri ayé fi ń rìn lọ sí orí “òkè-ń lá” tí ó ga ju ti à wọnHimalayalọ.
examples.english: Religion is also the reason why millions around the world are trekking to the “mountain” higher than the Himalayas.

examples.yoruba: Lá pá à ríwá, tó jẹ́ ibi tó jìnnà gan-an lórílẹ̀-èdè náà, à wọn yìnyín tó wà nílẹ̀ à tà wọn tó dì lókìtì lókìtì sórí ÒkèHimalayam áa ń yọ́, wọ́n á wá ṣàn lọ sínú à wọn odò.
examples.english: In the far north, rivers are fed in springtime by melting snows and glaciers in the Himalaya Mountains.

examples.yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n ó dá jú péHimalayani odò ń lá yìí ti ṣàn wá.
examples.english: But that this great river originates high up in the Himalayasis certain.

examples.yoruba: Omi tó ń ṣàn wá lá tinú ìṣàn yìnyín tó wà lórí Òkè ŃláHimalayam áa ń bẹ̀rẹ̀ dídà ní oṣù June, kì í dà lóṣù April nígbà tí òjò kì í fi bẹ́ẹ̀ rọ̀ tá wọn à gbẹ̀ sì nílò omi lá ti bomi rin oko wọn.
examples.english: The runoff from natural glaciers located high in the Himalaya Mountains begins in the month of June, not in April when rain is scanty and the farmers need water to irrigate their fields.

examples.yoruba: Bí odò náà ṣe ń sún mọ́ à à là Íń díà lá gbègbè Ladakh, ó ṣàn gba à á rín à wọn òkè ń láń lá, ó ṣẹ́rí gba ìsà lẹ̀ à wọn ibi gẹ̀rẹ́gẹ̀rẹ́ à pá ta, ó sì wá di ọ̀nà lá àárín à wọn òkèHimalayaà ti Karakoram.
examples.english: As the river approaches the borders of India in the Ladakh region, it works its way through the mountains, wearing into the base of cliffs to form a channel between the Himalayanand Karakoram ranges.

examples.yoruba: Síbẹ̀, lónìí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ní Nepal ń gun òkè-ń lá kan tí ó ga ju à wọn òkè-ń lá tiHimalayalọ!
examples.english: Yet, today many people in Nepal are climbing a mountain that is higher than the Himalayas!

examples.yoruba: LÁTI à wọn orí ÒkèHimalayaà wòṣífìlà, tí yìnyín bò níhà à ríwá, títí dé etí Òkun Íń díà tí ń hó gùdù níhà gúúsù, Íń díà jẹ́ ilẹ̀ ọlọ́kàn-ò-jọ̀kan, ní ti bí ilẹ̀ ibẹ̀ ṣe rí à ti ní ti ọ̀ràn ẹ̀sìn.
examples.english: FROM the majestic, snow-covered Himalaya Mountains in the north to the steamy shores of the Indian Ocean to the south, India is a land of diversity, geographically and religiously.

examples.yoruba: Gun Òkè Tí Ó Ga Ju Ti ÀwọnHimalayaLọ
examples.english: Climb Higher Than the Himalayas

examples.yoruba: Ìwọ pẹ̀lú lè gbá dùn gígun òkè-ń lá tí ó ga ju ti à wọnHimalayalọ.
examples.english: You too can enjoy the trek up the mountain that is higher than the Himalayas.

examples.yoruba: Fún à pẹẹrẹ, ní 40 ọdún tí ó kọjá, wọ́n ti gé à á dọ́ta ìpín nínú ọgọ́rùn-ún lá ra igbó Nepal, níHimalayalulẹ̀, níto rí igi ìdá ná tà bí níto rí à wọn ohun tí à ń fi gẹdú ṣe.
examples.english: For example, during the last 40 years, 50 percent of Nepal's Himalayanforests have been cut down either for firewood or for timber products.

examples.yoruba: Gígun Òkè-Ńlá Tí Ó Ga Ju Ti ÀwọnHimalayaLọ
examples.english: Ascending a Mountain Higher Than the Himalayas

examples.yoruba: A sì lọ sílùú Darjeeling tó wà nísà lẹ̀ à wọn òkèHimalayaní apá à ríwá lọ́sẹ̀ tó tẹ̀ lé e lá ti lọ bójú tó à péjọ à yíká mìíràn.
examples.english: Then we traveled north to Darjeeling in the Himalayanfoothills to serve another assembly the following week.

examples.yoruba: Ní nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún kìlómítà sí ìhà gúúsù orísun odò Indus ní òkè ń láHimalayani odò Ganga ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìrìn à jò tirẹ̀ tó lé ní ẹgbàá ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta [2,500] kìlómítà lọ síbi Ìyawọlẹ̀ Omi Òkun Bengal.
examples.english: About 60 miles [100 km] south of the Himalayansource of the Indus, the Ganga begins its journey of more than 1,600 miles [2,500 km] to the Bay of Bengal.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tó ń ṣàn ki ri yìí, ó gba ìhà à ríwá, lẹ́yìn náà ló wá ṣẹ́rí bìrí gba etí ìhà ìwọ̀ oòrùnHimalaya, níbi tí odò Gilgit ti ṣàn wọnú rẹ̀, èyí tó ń tú já de lá ti inú à pá ta Hindu Kush.
examples.english: During this plunge it travels north and then takes a sharp turn around the western edge of the Himalayas, where it is joined by the Gilgit, a large river surging out of the Hindu Kush.

examples.yoruba: James Scott dojú kọ ìbéèrè yẹn nígbà tí ó sọ nù lá ìnírètí ní Òkè ŃláHimalaya.
examples.english: James Scott faced that question when he was hopelessly lost in the Himalaya Mountains.

examples.yoruba: ÀwọnHimalayatí ń múni kún fún ìbẹ̀rù ọlọ́wọ̀, èyí tí ó pà àlà sí ìhà à ríwá, ní nínú Òkè-Ńlá Everest, òkè tí ó ga jùlọ ní ayé ní mítà 8,848, à ti à wọn òkè mẹ́jọ mìíràn tí ó ju 8,000 mítà lọ.
examples.english: The awe-inspiring Himalayas, which form the northern boundary, include Mount Everest, the tallest peak in the world at 29,028 feet [8,848 m], and eight other peaks over 26,200 feet [8,000 m].

examples.yoruba: ÀWỌNHimalaya!
examples.english: THEHimalayas!

examples.yoruba: himalaya
examples.english: himalayas

examples.yoruba: Ìrètí èyí kéyìí tí à wọn Júù ní lá ti tún tẹ́ń pìlì náà kọ́ wọmi, bí Olú Ọba Róòmù, Hadrian, ṣe kéde pé wọn kò gbọdọ̀ fẹsẹ̀ tẹ Jerúsá lẹ́mù mọ́, à yà fi ní ọjọ́ à yá jọ́ ìparun tẹ́ń pìlì náà.
examples.english: Any hopes of rebuilding the temple were dashed as Roman Emperor Hadriandeclared Jerusalem off limits to Jews, except on the anniversary of the temple's destruction.

examples.yoruba: Hadrianfi kún à wọn ilé kí kọyọyọ tí ń bẹ nínú ìlú náà, ó sì fi ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀bùn ta á lọ́rẹ.
examples.english: Hadrianadded to its architectural magnificence and made many generous donations.

examples.yoruba: Ágírípà ló bẹ̀rẹ̀ rẹ̀ ní nǹkan bí ọdún 27 ṣá ájú Sà nm ánì Tiwa, Hadriansì tún un kọ́ ní nǹkan bí ọdún 120 Sà nm ánì Tiwa.
examples.english: Begun by Agrippa in about 27 B. C. E., it was rebuilt by Hadrianabout 120 C. E.

examples.yoruba: Níto rí tí à wọn ọba Róòmù bíHadrianà ti Valerian mọ̀ pé ipò pà tàkì ni Pá límírà dì mú, wọ́n wá ṣèbẹ̀wò síbẹ̀.
examples.english: Recognizing its pivotal position, such Roman emperors as Hadrianand Valerian visited Palmyra.

examples.yoruba: Ńṣe ni ilé tò lọ gẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀gẹ̀ lá pá ọ̀tún à ti lá pá òsì Òpópónà Curete yìí. Lá ra wọn ni gbọ̀ngàn tí wọ́n ti ń jíròrò ọ̀rọ̀ ìlú, tẹ́ń pìlìHadrian, à wọn ìsun omi, à tà wọn ilé tí wọ́n kọ́ sí ẹ̀gbẹ̀ẹ̀gbẹ́ òkè tá wọn sà ràkí èèyàn ìlú Éfésù ń gbé lá tijọ́.
examples.english: The Street of the Curetes is lined on both sides with buildings, such as the State agora where matters of State were discussed, the temple of Hadrian, some public fountains, and terrace houses —abodes of distinguished Ephesians.

examples.yoruba: Lẹ́yìn náà, ní nǹkan bí ọdún 138 Sà nm ánì Tiwa, ní ilé Olú ỌbaHadrianní Tivoli, iṣẹ́ ìrísí ojú ilẹ̀ ti Róòmù dé òtéń té rẹ̀.
examples.english: Later, about 138 C. E., at Emperor Hadrian'svilla at Tivoli, Roman landscaping reached its zenith.

examples.yoruba: Ìwé kan tó sọ nípa bí wọ́n ṣe ń kọ̀wé à ti bí wọ́n ṣe ń kà wé nígbà ayé Jésù, ìyẹn Reading and Writing in the Time of Jesus sọ pé: “Àwọn à wòr án lá ti ìlú Pompeii ní gúúsù Ítá lì, à wọn ère lá ti ibi gbogbo ní Ilẹ̀ Ọba Róòmù à tà wọn ohun tí wọ́n hú já de ká àki ri ilẹ̀ Íjíbítì à ti OdiHadriantó wà ní Àríwá Ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì fi bí wọ́n ṣe ń lo wà láà níbi gbogbo hàn.”
examples.english: The book Reading and Writing in the Time of Jesus says: “Paintings from Pompeii, sculptures from various parts of the Roman Empire and actual examples dug up at many sites scattered from Egypt to Hadrian's Wall [Northern Britain] display the widespread use of the tablets.”

hadrian is the translation of "hadrian" into English. Sample translated sentence: Hadrian fi kún àwọn ilé kíkọyọyọ tí ń bẹ nínú ìlú náà, ó sì fi ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀bùn ta á lọ́rẹ. ↔ Hadrian added to its architectural magnificence and made many generous donations.

Translations of "hadrian" into English in sentences, translation memory

Hadrian fi kún àwọn ilé kíkọyọyọ tí ń bẹ nínú ìlú náà, ó sì fi ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀bùn ta á lọ́rẹ.
Hadrian added to its architectural magnificence and made many generous donations.
jw2019
Ágírípà ló bẹ̀rẹ̀ rẹ̀ ní nǹkan bí ọdún 27 ṣáájú Sànmánì Tiwa, Hadrian sì tún un kọ́ ní nǹkan bí ọdún 120 Sànmánì Tiwa.
Begun by Agrippa in about 27 B.C.E., it was rebuilt by Hadrian about 120 C.E.
jw2019
Nítorí tí àwọn ọba Róòmù bí Hadrian àti Valerian mọ̀ pé ipò pàtàkì ni Pálímírà dì mú, wọ́n wá ṣèbẹ̀wò síbẹ̀.
Recognizing its pivotal position, such Roman emperors as Hadrian and Valerian visited Palmyra.
jw2019
Ńṣe ni ilé tò lọ gẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀gẹ̀ lápá ọ̀tún àti lápá òsì Òpópónà Curete yìí. Lára wọn ni gbọ̀ngàn tí wọ́n ti ń jíròrò ọ̀rọ̀ ìlú, tẹ́ńpìlì Hadrian, àwọn ìsun omi, àtàwọn ilé tí wọ́n kọ́ sí ẹ̀gbẹ̀ẹ̀gbẹ́ òkè táwọn sàràkí èèyàn ìlú Éfésù ń gbé látijọ́.
The Street of the Curetes is lined on both sides with buildings, such as the State agora where matters of State were discussed, the temple of Hadrian, some public fountains, and terrace houses —abodes of distinguished Ephesians.
jw2019
Lẹ́yìn náà, ní nǹkan bí ọdún 138 Sànmánì Tiwa, ní ilé Olú Ọba Hadrian ní Tivoli, iṣẹ́ ìrísí ojú ilẹ̀ ti Róòmù dé òtéńté rẹ̀.
Later, about 138 C.E., at Emperor Hadrian’s villa at Tivoli, Roman landscaping reached its zenith.
jw2019
Ìwé kan tó sọ nípa bí wọ́n ṣe ń kọ̀wé àti bí wọ́n ṣe ń kàwé nígbà ayé Jésù, ìyẹn Reading and Writing in the Time of Jesus sọ pé: “Àwọn àwòrán láti ìlú Pompeii ní gúúsù Ítálì, àwọn ère láti ibi gbogbo ní Ilẹ̀ Ọba Róòmù àtàwọn ohun tí wọ́n hú jáde káàkiri ilẹ̀ Íjíbítì àti Odi Hadrian tó wà ní Àríwá Ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì fi bí wọ́n ṣe ń lo wàláà níbi gbogbo hàn.”
The book Reading and Writing in the Time of Jesus says: “Paintings from Pompeii, sculptures from various parts of the Roman Empire and actual examples dug up at many sites scattered from Egypt to Hadrian’s Wall [Northern Britain] display the widespread use of the tablets.”
jw2019
Ìrètí èyíkéyìí tí àwọn Júù ní láti tún tẹ́ńpìlì náà kọ́ wọmi, bí Olú Ọba Róòmù, Hadrian, ṣe kéde pé wọn kò gbọdọ̀ fẹsẹ̀ tẹ Jerúsálẹ́mù mọ́, àyàfi ní ọjọ́ àyájọ́ ìparun tẹ́ńpìlì náà.
Any hopes of rebuilding the temple were dashed as Roman Emperor Hadrian declared Jerusalem off limits to Jews, except on the anniversary of the temple’s destruction.
jw2019
